##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:16:22.115Z ##

Cyble: The Re-Emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks (emailwall)
Let me save you the click: the attacker IOC is 185[.]190[.]24[.]111. I don't get why they added a "give us your personal contact information for more technical details," this is a security worst practice.

Cyble reports exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-32113, and emphasized that the assigning of CVE-2024-45195 (which Rapid7 claims is a patch bypass for multiple CVEs with the same underlying issue which I believe is "permission check for ProgramExport and EntitySQLProcessor") resulted in more exploitation attempts.

References:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to KEV Catalog 07 August 2024) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution

#CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_45195 #apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.059Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T15:16:22.000Z ##

Cyble: The Re-Emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks (emailwall)
Let me save you the click: the attacker IOC is 185[.]190[.]24[.]111. I don't get why they added a "give us your personal contact information for more technical details," this is a security worst practice.

Cyble reports exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-32113, and emphasized that the assigning of CVE-2024-45195 (which Rapid7 claims is a patch bypass for multiple CVEs with the same underlying issue which I believe is "permission check for ProgramExport and EntitySQLProcessor") resulted in more exploitation attempts.

References:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to KEV Catalog 07 August 2024) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

CVE-2024-45195 :: Forced Browsing vulnerability in Apache OfBiz.. #PatchNOW

Advisory:

https://lists.apache.org/thread/o90dd9lbk1hh3t2557t2y2qvrh92p7wy

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OFBIZ-13130

RApid7 Blog:

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/05/cve-2024-45195-apache-ofbiz-unauthenticated-remote-code-execution-fixed/

Patch Download and Release Information:

https://ofbiz.apache.org/download.html

Note: This is a patch bypass for PREVIOUSLY EXPLOITED vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104 and CVE-2024-38856.

CVE-2024-7591
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-06T12:08:21.290000

5 posts

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Progress LoadMaster allows OS Command Injection.This issue affects: * LoadMaster: 7.2.40.0 and above * ECS: All versions * Multi-Tenancy: 7.1.35.4 and above

screaminggoat at 2024-09-08T14:21:47.356Z ##

Progress Kemp security advisory: LoadMaster Security Vulnerability CVE-2024-7591
CVE-2024-7591 (perfect 10.0 🥳 cc: @cR0w, disclosed 04 September 2024) mproper Input Validation vulnerability in Progress LoadMaster allows OS Command Injection.This issue affects: * LoadMaster: 7.2.40.0 and above * ECS: All versions * Multi-Tenancy: 7.1.35.4 and above

We have not received any reports that this vulnerability has been exploited and we are not aware of any direct impact to customers.

hat tip to @BleepingComputer. See their related reporting: Progress LoadMaster vulnerable to 10/10 severity RCE flaw

#CVE_2024_7591 #progresssoftware #vulnerability #cve #kemp #loadmaster

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-08T14:21:47.000Z ##

Progress Kemp security advisory: LoadMaster Security Vulnerability CVE-2024-7591
CVE-2024-7591 (perfect 10.0 🥳 cc: @cR0w, disclosed 04 September 2024) mproper Input Validation vulnerability in Progress LoadMaster allows OS Command Injection.This issue affects: * LoadMaster: 7.2.40.0 and above * ECS: All versions * Multi-Tenancy: 7.1.35.4 and above

We have not received any reports that this vulnerability has been exploited and we are not aware of any direct impact to customers.

hat tip to @BleepingComputer. See their related reporting: Progress LoadMaster vulnerable to 10/10 severity RCE flaw

#CVE_2024_7591 #progresssoftware #vulnerability #cve #kemp #loadmaster

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-08T14:21:47.356Z ##

Progress Kemp security advisory: LoadMaster Security Vulnerability CVE-2024-7591
CVE-2024-7591 (perfect 10.0 🥳 cc: @cR0w, disclosed 04 September 2024) mproper Input Validation vulnerability in Progress LoadMaster allows OS Command Injection.This issue affects: * LoadMaster: 7.2.40.0 and above * ECS: All versions * Multi-Tenancy: 7.1.35.4 and above

We have not received any reports that this vulnerability has been exploited and we are not aware of any direct impact to customers.

hat tip to @BleepingComputer. See their related reporting: Progress LoadMaster vulnerable to 10/10 severity RCE flaw

#CVE_2024_7591 #progresssoftware #vulnerability #cve #kemp #loadmaster

CVE-2024-7012
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-05T21:39:20.950000

1 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability has been identified in Foreman when deployed with External Authentication, due to the puppet-foreman configuration. This issue arises from Apache's mod_proxy not properly unsetting headers because of restrictions on underscores in HTTP headers, allowing authentication through a malformed header. This flaw impacts all active Satellite deployments (6.13, 6.14 a

zhenech@chaos.social at 2024-09-06T16:58:45.000Z ##

One interesting observation about CVE-2024-7012 and CVE-2024-7923 (see https://theforeman.org/security.html): those should be absolutely trivial to scan for (REMOTE_USER is pretty much what every single default config uses), yet none of the 1000 "our security scanner found these vulnerabilities, fix ASAP!!!" reports we get from customers ever flagged that. But Apache MultiViews 🙄

CVE-2024-43102
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-05T21:23:40.503000

6 posts

Concurrent removals of certain anonymous shared memory mappings by using the UMTX_SHM_DESTROY sub-request of UMTX_OP_SHM can lead to decreasing the reference count of the object representing the mapping too many times, causing it to be freed too early. A malicious code exercizing the UMTX_SHM_DESTROY sub-request in parallel can panic the kernel or enable further Use-After-Free attacks, potentiall

1 repos

updated 2024-09-05T13:30:33.680000

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-03T15:00:52.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-7262
Vendor: Kingsoft
Product: WPS Office
Date Added: 2024-09-03
Vulnerability: Kingsoft WPS Office Path Traversal Vulnerability
Notes: While CISA cannot confirm the effectiveness of patches at this time, it is recommended that mitigations be applied per vendor instructions if available. If these instructions cannot be located or if mitigations are unavailable, discontinue the use of the product.
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-7262

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-03T14:15:01.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press!

  • CVE-2024-7262 (9.3 critical) Kingsoft WPS Office Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-20124 (7.5 high) Draytek VigorConnect Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2021-20123 (7.5 high) Draytek VigorConnect Path Traversal Vulnerability

##

CVE-2024-20439
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-05T12:53:21.110000

5 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco Smart Licensing Utility could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to log in to an affected system by using a static administrative credential. This vulnerability is due to an undocumented static user credential for an administrative account. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by using the static credentials to log in to the affected system. A successful

CVE-2024-20439 & CVE-2024-20440: Critical #Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog/cve-2024-20439-cve-2024-20440-critical-cisco-smart-licensing-utility-vulnerabilities/ #cybersecurity #infosec

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-05T12:33:35.762Z ##

Multiple Critical Vulnerabilities in Cisco Smart Licensing Utilities : CVE-2024-20439 and CVE-2024-20440.. #patchnow

Advisory:
https://sec.cloudapps.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-cslu-7gHMzWmw

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-04T16:48:01.586Z ##

Cisco security advisories includes a zero-day:

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP
  • Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

EDIT: What @BleepingComputer took away out of this is that CVE-2024-20439 is a backdoor admin account: Cisco warns of backdoor admin account in Smart Licensing Utility

#zeroday #cisco #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20469 #cve #CVE_2024_20439

Cisco security advisories includes a zero-day:

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP
  • Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

5 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco Smart Licensing Utility could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to access sensitive information. This vulnerability is due to excessive verbosity in a debug log file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted HTTP request to an affected device. A successful exploit could allow the attacker to obtain log files that contain sensitive data,

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP

    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

CVE-2024-43402
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-05T12:53:21.110000

6 posts

Rust is a programming language. The fix for CVE-2024-24576, where `std::process::Command` incorrectly escaped arguments when invoking batch files on Windows, was incomplete. Prior to Rust version 1.81.0, it was possible to bypass the fix when the batch file name had trailing whitespace or periods (which are ignored and stripped by Windows). To determine whether to apply the `cmd.exe` escaping rule

1 repos

screaminggoat at 2024-09-04T16:48:01.586Z ##

Cisco security advisories includes a zero-day:

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP
  • Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

screaminggoat at 2024-09-04T18:30:47.645Z ##

Qualcomm security advisory: September 2024 Security Bulletin
8 proprietary software issues, and 12 open source software issues. No mention of exploitation. Surprise appearance from Google Project Zero as Seth @jenkins is credited with CVE-2024-38401 (7.8 high) Use After Free in Qualcomm IPC and @jann Horn is credited with CVE-2024-38402 (7.8 high) Use After Free in DSP Services.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T12:02:07.444Z ##

@browserversiontracker @ruario was there no check for Microsoft Edge?
MSRC released a bunch of advisories last night:

  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38222
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8362

##

CVE-2023-41993
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.31%

updated 2024-09-03T20:19:59.450000

2 posts

The issue was addressed with improved checks. This issue is fixed in macOS Sonoma 14. Processing web content may lead to arbitrary code execution. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited against versions of iOS before iOS 16.7.

4 repos

https://github.com/Mangaia/cve-test

https://github.com/J3Ss0u/CVE-2023-41993

https://github.com/po6ix/POC-for-CVE-2023-41993

https://github.com/hrtowii/cve-2023-41993-test

avolha at 2024-09-07T11:54:56.820Z ##

Okazało się, że powiązana z rosyjskim rządem grupa APT29, znana też jako Midnight Blizzard czy Cozy Bear, od listopada 2023 r. do lipca 2024 r. korzystała z exploitów na iOS i Androida zaskakująco podobnych do tych, które opracowali komercyjni producenci oprogramowania szpiegującego, tacy jak NSO Group i Intellexa (pierwszy stworzył Pegasusa, drugi Predatora).

Najpierw atakujący włamali się na strony cabinet.gov[.]mn i mfa.gov[.]mn należące do władz Mongolii i posługując się techniką wodopoju (ang. watering hole), dostarczali użytkownikom exploit wykorzystujący lukę CVE-2023-41993 w silniku WebKit na platformie iOS 16.6.1 i starszych. Atak koncentrował się na kradzieży ciasteczek. W kolejnej kampanii grupa zaktualizowała zresztą listę interesujących ją docelowych stron. Według ekspertów niemal identyczny exploit został użyty we wrześniu 2023 r. w oprogramowaniu firmy Intellexa.

Ostatnia opisana w raporcie kampania skupiała się już na użytkownikach Androida. W tym przypadku atakujący posłużyli się exploitami wykorzystującymi podatności CVE-2024-5274 i CVE-2024-4671 w przeglądarce Google Chrome. Badacze ustalili, że exploit na pierwszą z wymienionych luk był podobny do stosowanego przez NSO Group w maju 2024 r., choć koncepcyjnie trochę się od niego różnił. Drugi exploit wykazywał wiele podobieństw do tych, które w przeszłości stworzyła Intellexa.

Badacze nie są pewni, w jaki sposób APT29 uzyskała dostęp do exploitów używanych wcześniej jedynie przez komercyjnych dostawców narzędzi nadzoru. Nie jest wykluczone, że zostały one kupione od brokera luk, który najpierw sprzedał je firmom NSO Group i Intellexa jako 0-dniowe.

Cała analiza: https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/state-backed-attackers-and-commercial-surveillance-vendors-repeatedly-use-the-same-exploits/

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #apt29 #nsogroup #intellexa

##
avolha@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-07T11:54:56.000Z ##

Okazało się, że powiązana z rosyjskim rządem grupa APT29, znana też jako Midnight Blizzard czy Cozy Bear, od listopada 2023 r. do lipca 2024 r. korzystała z exploitów na iOS i Androida zaskakująco podobnych do tych, które opracowali komercyjni producenci oprogramowania szpiegującego, tacy jak NSO Group i Intellexa (pierwszy stworzył Pegasusa, drugi Predatora).

Najpierw atakujący włamali się na strony cabinet.gov[.]mn i mfa.gov[.]mn należące do władz Mongolii i posługując się techniką wodopoju (ang. watering hole), dostarczali użytkownikom exploit wykorzystujący lukę CVE-2023-41993 w silniku WebKit na platformie iOS 16.6.1 i starszych. Atak koncentrował się na kradzieży ciasteczek. W kolejnej kampanii grupa zaktualizowała zresztą listę interesujących ją docelowych stron. Według ekspertów niemal identyczny exploit został użyty we wrześniu 2023 r. w oprogramowaniu firmy Intellexa.

Ostatnia opisana w raporcie kampania skupiała się już na użytkownikach Androida. W tym przypadku atakujący posłużyli się exploitami wykorzystującymi podatności CVE-2024-5274 i CVE-2024-4671 w przeglądarce Google Chrome. Badacze ustalili, że exploit na pierwszą z wymienionych luk był podobny do stosowanego przez NSO Group w maju 2024 r., choć koncepcyjnie trochę się od niego różnił. Drugi exploit wykazywał wiele podobieństw do tych, które w przeszłości stworzyła Intellexa.

Badacze nie są pewni, w jaki sposób APT29 uzyskała dostęp do exploitów używanych wcześniej jedynie przez komercyjnych dostawców narzędzi nadzoru. Nie jest wykluczone, że zostały one kupione od brokera luk, który najpierw sprzedał je firmom NSO Group i Intellexa jako 0-dniowe.

Cała analiza: https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/state-backed-attackers-and-commercial-surveillance-vendors-repeatedly-use-the-same-exploits/

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #apt29 #nsogroup #intellexa

updated 2024-09-03T15:15:15.937000

Webpack is a module bundler. Its main purpose is to bundle JavaScript files for usage in a browser, yet it is also capable of transforming, bundling, or packaging just about any resource or asset. The DOM Clobbering gadget in the module can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) in web pag

#search_error

avoidthehack at 2024-09-04T16:02:01.747Z ##

Zyxel warns of critical OS command injection flaw in routers

The OS command injection is tracked as CVE-2024-7261 and affects various Zyxel access point models and a #security router product.

Security routers are updated by cloud and patches are available for the affected access points. Update ASAP.

#cybersecurity #infosec #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/zyxel-warns-of-critical-os-command-injection-flaw-in-routers/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-04T14:27:15.750Z ##

Zyxel security advisory for OS command injection vulnerability in APs and security router devices

CVE-2024-7261 (9.8 critical) improper neutralization in multiple Zyxel routers and access points allow for OS command injection. No mention of exploitation.
See related reporting from

  • Bleeping Computer: Zyxel warns of critical OS command injection flaw in routers
  • The Hacker News: Zyxel Patches Critical OS Command Injection Flaw in Access Points and Routers

#zyxel #vulnerability #CVE_2024_7261

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-04T11:26:53.180Z ##

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-7261 and assigned a CVSS v3 score of 9.8 ("critical"), is an input validation fault caused by improper handling of user-supplied data, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands on the host operating system. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/zyxel-warns-of-critical-os-command-injection-flaw-in-routers/

screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T12:02:07.444Z ##

  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38222

CVE-2024-20446
(8.6 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-08-29T13:25:27.537000

1 posts

A vulnerability in the DHCPv6 relay agent of Cisco NX-OS Software could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to cause a denial of service (DoS) condition on an affected device. This vulnerability is due to improper handling of specific fields in a DHCPv6 RELAY-REPLY message. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a crafted DHCPv6 packet to any IPv6 address that is configur

tecteschi@mastodon.social at 2024-09-03T15:26:26.000Z ##

https://go.tecteschi.com/ping/7410438582310914145 #cybersecurity
#Cisco ha publicado actualizaciones de seguridad para el software NX-OS, abordando múltiples vulnerabilidades, incluida una de alta gravedad con el identificador CVE-2024-20446. Esta vulnerabilidad afecta al agente de retransmisión DHCPv6 de NX-OS, y un atacante podría explotarla para provocar una condición de denegación de servicio (DoS).

Descripción de la Vulnerabilidad:
La vulnerabilidad se debe a un manejo inade

Nuclei template

7 repos

https://github.com/securelayer7/CVE-2024-38856_Scanner

https://github.com/codeb0ss/CVE-2024-38856-PoC

screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.059Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

CVE-2024-45195 :: Forced Browsing vulnerability in Apache OfBiz.. #PatchNOW

https://lists.apache.org/thread/o90dd9lbk1hh3t2557t2y2qvrh92p7wy

RApid7 Blog:

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/05/cve-2024-45195-apache-ofbiz-unauthenticated-remote-code-execution-fixed/

Patch Download and Release Information:

https://ofbiz.apache.org/download.html

Note: This is a patch bypass for PREVIOUSLY EXPLOITED vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104 and CVE-2024-38856.

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-04T13:50:05.000Z ##

FudModule Rootkit Targets Crypto, Linked to North Korean Citrine Sleet Group

North Korean threat actor, Citrine Sleet, has been observed exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in Chromium, designated as CVE-2024-7971, to RCE.

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/rwwg6h

##
VirusBulletin at 2024-09-02T09:29:38.398Z ##

Microsoft researchers share details on the North Korean threat actor Citrine Sleet and the observed tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs) used to exploit CVE-2024-7971, deploy the FudModule rootkit, and compromise systems. https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/security/blog/2024/08/30/north-korean-threat-actor-citrine-sleet-exploiting-chromium-zero-day/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-30T17:26:00.592Z ##

Microsoft: North Korean threat actor Citrine Sleet exploiting Chromium zero-day

On August 19, 2024, Microsoft identified a North Korean threat actor exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in Chromium, now identified as CVE-2024-7971, to gain remote code execution (RCE). We assess with high confidence that the observed exploitation of CVE-2024-7971 can be attributed to a North Korean threat actor targeting the cryptocurrency sector for financial gain. Our ongoing analysis and observed infrastructure lead us to attribute this activity with medium confidence to Citrine Sleet. We note that while the FudModule rootkit deployed has also been attributed to Diamond Sleet, another North Korean threat actor, Microsoft previously identified shared infrastructure and tools between Diamond Sleet and Citrine Sleet, and our analysis indicates this might be shared use of the FudModule malware between these threat actors.

#northkorea #cyberespionage #APT #CitrineSleet #zeroday #CVE_2024_7971 #Chrome #Google #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #Infosec

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-08-30T17:20:06.000Z ##

North Korean hackers exploit Chrome zero-day to deploy rootkit

North Korean hackers have exploited a recently patched Google Chrome zero-day (CVE-2024-7971) to deploy the FudModule rootkit after gaining SYSTEM...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/qf0k9d

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-30T17:26:00.000Z ##

Microsoft: North Korean threat actor Citrine Sleet exploiting Chromium zero-day

On August 19, 2024, Microsoft identified a North Korean threat actor exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in Chromium, now identified as CVE-2024-7971, to gain remote code execution (RCE). We assess with high confidence that the observed exploitation of CVE-2024-7971 can be attributed to a North Korean threat actor targeting the cryptocurrency sector for financial gain. Our ongoing analysis and observed infrastructure lead us to attribute this activity with medium confidence to Citrine Sleet. We note that while the FudModule rootkit deployed has also been attributed to Diamond Sleet, another North Korean threat actor, Microsoft previously identified shared infrastructure and tools between Diamond Sleet and Citrine Sleet, and our analysis indicates this might be shared use of the FudModule malware between these threat actors.

In Spring Cloud Data Flow versions prior to 2.11.4,  a malicious user who has access to the Skipper server api can use a crafted upload request to write an arbitrary file to any location on the file system which could lead to compromising the server

1 repos

#search_error

maodun at 2024-09-04T05:51:22.886Z ##

CVE-2024-37084: Spring Cloud Remote Code Execution https://blog.securelayer7.net/spring-cloud-skipper-vulnerability/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-03T14:35:52.088Z ##

SecureLayer7: CVE-2024-37084: Spring Cloud Remote Code Execution
SecureLayer7 has been churning out zero-day vulnerabilities (publicly releasing information about vulnerabilities without a coordinated vulnerability disclosure with the impacted vendor or assigning CVEs) and proofs of concepts for vulnerabilities. According to Spring.io, Spring Cloud Data Flow is a microservices-based Streaming and Batch data processing platform deployed in Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes. CVE-2024-37084 (9.8 CRITICAL) is an arbitrary file write. SecureLayer7 used patch diffing to determine that it’s an insecure deserialization vulnerability that leads to remote code execution, and provides a proof of concept for it.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_37084 #spring #cve #proofofconcept #poc

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-03T14:35:52.000Z ##

SecureLayer7: CVE-2024-37084: Spring Cloud Remote Code Execution
SecureLayer7 has been churning out zero-day vulnerabilities (publicly releasing information about vulnerabilities without a coordinated vulnerability disclosure with the impacted vendor or assigning CVEs) and proofs of concepts for vulnerabilities. According to Spring.io, Spring Cloud Data Flow is a microservices-based Streaming and Batch data processing platform deployed in Cloud Foundry and Kubernetes. CVE-2024-37084 (9.8 CRITICAL) is an arbitrary file write. SecureLayer7 used patch diffing to determine that it’s an insecure deserialization vulnerability that leads to remote code execution, and provides a proof of concept for it.

#vulnerability #CVE_2024_37084 #spring #cve #proofofconcept #poc

##

CVE-2024-39383
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-08-20T19:26:34.947000

4 posts

Acrobat Reader versions 20.005.30636, 24.002.20965, 24.002.20964, 24.001.30123 and earlier are affected by a Use After Free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T18:21:26.766Z ##

Bleeping Computer: Adobe fixes Acrobat Reader zero-day with public PoC exploit
References:

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (10 September 2024)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

Okay I already have an EXPMON thread here (see parent toots above) so I'll orphan the original Adobe September 2024 Patch Tuesday toot. It should be noted that CVE-2024-41869 (7.8 high) UAF to arbitrary code execution in Adobe Acrobat and Reader is a Zero Day (Proof of Concept exploit in the wild exists before the vulnerability was patched, unknown if actually exploited). Apparently the August patch wasn't sufficient for the vulnerability CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high, which should also be considered a zero-day). Haifei Li wrote on the Bad Place: "We tested the (exactly the same) sample on the "patched" Adobe Reader version, it displayed additional dialogs, but if the user clicked/closed those dialogs, the app still crashed! Same UAF bug!"

In yesterday's Adobe Reader security advisory, Adobe didn't call attention to the fact that a Proof of Concept exploit exists in the wild, or however they would normally word it.

#expmon #adobe #proofofconcept #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_41869 #CVE_2024_39383

##

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (10 September 2024)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.03%

updated 2024-08-20T13:34:22.773000

2 posts

Jenkins 2.441 and earlier, LTS 2.426.2 and earlier does not disable a feature of its CLI command parser that replaces an '@' character followed by a file path in an argument with the file's contents, allowing unauthenticated attackers to read arbitrary files on the Jenkins controller file system.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T03:13:39.721Z ##

ASEC: Jenkins Servers in Korea With Exposed Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23897, CVE-2024-43044)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) highlights the many thousands of internet-exposed Jenkins servers in Korea with identifiable version information, of which 2,824 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-23897 and 3,969 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-43044. They note that both vulnerabilities have publicly available Proofs of Concept (PoC) codes, and that CVE-2024-23897 is reportedly exploited in the wild (linking to CISA's KEV Catalog).

#Jenkins #Cve_2024_23897 #CVE_2024_43044 #vulnerability #CVE #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T03:13:39.000Z ##

ASEC: Jenkins Servers in Korea With Exposed Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23897, CVE-2024-43044)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) highlights the many thousands of internet-exposed Jenkins servers in Korea with identifiable version information, of which 2,824 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-23897 and 3,969 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-43044. They note that both vulnerabilities have publicly available Proofs of Concept (PoC) codes, and that CVE-2024-23897 is reportedly exploited in the wild (linking to CISA's KEV Catalog).

#Jenkins #Cve_2024_23897 #CVE_2024_43044 #vulnerability #CVE #eitw

updated 2024-08-16T20:54:12.043000

Windows TCP/IP Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

##
malwaretech at 2024-08-30T23:30:54.362Z ##

For a couple of years now I've been trying to assess the likelihood of critical Windows CVEs being mass exploited by reverse engineering the patches for them. A lot of the time, even after figuring out exactly how the vulnerability works, and how to exploit it, the answer is: I simply don't know.

There are so many variables involved, and it usually comes down to whether some security researcher is going to be an asshole by dumping full functional exploit code onto GitHub. For CVE-2024-38063, the bug has all the pieces needed to build a full RCE exploit, but the exploit trigger is contingent on certain network adapter behavior, and possibly also the driver's interrupt timer behavior, neither of which I know much about.

##
malwaretech at 2024-08-30T23:14:23.493Z ##

Wanted to share my thread about vulnerability scoring and overhyping vulnerabilities here too. It primarily stemmed from the discussion about whether CVE-2024-38063 was overhyped or not, but I think it translates well to vulnerability scoring in general.

Many people like to blame vendors or shortcomings in CVSS for overhyping vulnerabilities, but a lot of the time it's just that vulnerability scoring is really really difficult, especially for memory corruption vulnerabilities.

On a technical level, it's hard to know whether a memory corruption is practically and reliably exploitable. Whilst the person who discovered it may not have a stable exploit, someone could later come along and find a different technique that makes the exploit code infinitely more reliable.

Even in cases where a very severe vulnerability is reliably exploitable, widespread exploitation isn't guaranteed. Due to the mechanics of the cybercrime economy, there are very few skilled exploit developers on that side of things. Most of the high caliber vulnerability researchers are either doing cybersecurity work, or selling CNE capabilities to governments.

As a result, a lot of n-day exploitation is going to be low-level targeted attacks by state-sponsored threat actors, rather than indiscriminate mass exploitation by cybercriminals. To many outsiders, it may even appear as if a vulnerability never got picked up and exploited at all. The only people who are going to know any different are the unlucky chosen ones who got targeted.

The five alarm fires, which many of these dire warnings like "this vulnerability is wormable" and "drop everything & patch now" seek to avoid, are near impossible to predict in reality. The WannaCrys, and the BlueKeeps usually have external aggravating factors. In both cases, this was fully function exploit code being released publicly. Most threat actors don't have top-tier exploit development capabilities, but every single one of them can use Google.

The difference between a typical cybersecurity incident and the worst ransomware attack the world has ever seen, can be as simple as one person's decision to publish exploit code. Nobody has a crystal ball to tell if or when that might happen, but by the time it does, it's way too late to start issuing warnings.

So if you're feeling frustrated having to drop everything to patch yet another nothing-burger CVSS 9.0+ vulnerability, just remember that the decision of a single individual can quickly turned that nothing-burger into a threat actor spray & pray free-for-all.

##
briankrebs at 2024-08-30T20:06:05.361Z ##

FYI, an exploit has been released for the zero-click IPv6 vulnerability that Microsoft patched this month in Win 10/11/Server systems. The SANS Internet Storm Center says the released exploit code will cause vulnerable systems to crash, but unreliably.

Chances are decent that some smart people are working on more reliable exploits against this flaw, perhaps even those that actually achieve code execution. Probably best to patch this one soon if you haven't already for some reason.

Further reading (the SANS bit was from their email newsletter):
https://www.theregister.com/2024/08/28/proofofconcept_code_released_for_zeroclick/?is=1ef7934f6635b02395adcab09a0c1b24bf0ea745b648bfe87189de8aadc7300b

https://malwaretech.com/2024/08/exploiting-CVE-2024-38063.html

##
Sempf at 2024-08-30T03:33:59.343Z ##

https://github.com/ynwarcs/CVE-2024-38063/tree/main

##
malwaretech@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-30T23:14:23.000Z ##

Wanted to share my thread about vulnerability scoring and overhyping vulnerabilities here too. It primarily stemmed from the discussion about whether CVE-2024-38063 was overhyped or not, but I think it translates well to vulnerability scoring in general.

Many people like to blame vendors or shortcomings in CVSS for overhyping vulnerabilities, but a lot of the time it's just that vulnerability scoring is really really difficult, especially for memory corruption vulnerabilities.

On a technical level, it's hard to know whether a memory corruption is practically and reliably exploitable. Whilst the person who discovered it may not have a stable exploit, someone could later come along and find a different technique that makes the exploit code infinitely more reliable.

Even in cases where a very severe vulnerability is reliably exploitable, widespread exploitation isn't guaranteed. Due to the mechanics of the cybercrime economy, there are very few skilled exploit developers on that side of things. Most of the high caliber vulnerability researchers are either doing cybersecurity work, or selling CNE capabilities to governments.

As a result, a lot of n-day exploitation is going to be low-level targeted attacks by state-sponsored threat actors, rather than indiscriminate mass exploitation by cybercriminals. To many outsiders, it may even appear as if a vulnerability never got picked up and exploited at all. The only people who are going to know any different are the unlucky chosen ones who got targeted.

The five alarm fires, which many of these dire warnings like "this vulnerability is wormable" and "drop everything & patch now" seek to avoid, are near impossible to predict in reality. The WannaCrys, and the BlueKeeps usually have external aggravating factors. In both cases, this was fully function exploit code being released publicly. Most threat actors don't have top-tier exploit development capabilities, but every single one of them can use Google.

The difference between a typical cybersecurity incident and the worst ransomware attack the world has ever seen, can be as simple as one person's decision to publish exploit code. Nobody has a crystal ball to tell if or when that might happen, but by the time it does, it's way too late to start issuing warnings.

So if you're feeling frustrated having to drop everything to patch yet another nothing-burger CVSS 9.0+ vulnerability, just remember that the decision of a single individual can quickly turned that nothing-burger into a threat actor spray & pray free-for-all.

##

CVE-2024-43044
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-16T17:19:30.643000

7 posts

Jenkins 2.470 and earlier, LTS 2.452.3 and earlier allows agent processes to read arbitrary files from the Jenkins controller file system by using the `ClassLoaderProxy#fetchJar` method in the Remoting library.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T03:13:39.721Z ##

ASEC: Jenkins Servers in Korea With Exposed Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23897, CVE-2024-43044)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) highlights the many thousands of internet-exposed Jenkins servers in Korea with identifiable version information, of which 2,824 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-23897 and 3,969 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-43044. They note that both vulnerabilities have publicly available Proofs of Concept (PoC) codes, and that CVE-2024-23897 is reportedly exploited in the wild (linking to CISA's KEV Catalog).

#Jenkins #Cve_2024_23897 #CVE_2024_43044 #vulnerability #CVE #eitw

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T03:13:39.000Z ##

ASEC: Jenkins Servers in Korea With Exposed Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23897, CVE-2024-43044)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) highlights the many thousands of internet-exposed Jenkins servers in Korea with identifiable version information, of which 2,824 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-23897 and 3,969 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-43044. They note that both vulnerabilities have publicly available Proofs of Concept (PoC) codes, and that CVE-2024-23897 is reportedly exploited in the wild (linking to CISA's KEV Catalog).

#Jenkins #Cve_2024_23897 #CVE_2024_43044 #vulnerability #CVE #eitw

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-02T14:22:08.324Z ##

When it comes to a vulnerability's exploitability, a proof of concept being disclosed increases those odds. Does every CVE with a PoC get exploited? Definitely not. In this case however, a cybercriminal recently shared a Proof of Concept (PoC) on a dark web forum for CVE-2024-43044, a Jenkins server arbitrary file read vulnerability (See parent toot above for the security advisory). Threat actors talking about exploiting a vulnerability adds a bit more weight to the exploitability odds.

There's a technical analysis and a proof of concept for CVE-2024-43044 if you wanted to learn more.

cc: @todb

#jenkins #CVE_2024_43033 #vulnerability #CVE #proofofconcept #poc

##

Update: Exploits for CVE-2024-43044 : Path Transversal vulnerability in Jenkins is available publicly. IF YOU HAVEN'T PATCHED IT YET, PATCH IT NOW!!

https://github.com/convisolabs/CVE-2024-43044-jenkins?tab=readme-ov-file

updated 2024-08-14T19:33:40.713000

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-04T18:11:48.617Z ##

@happygeek it's a bit late to include this information since you already published it but GrapheneOS Foundation, a Canadian non-profit (privacy-enhanced and security-focused Android distribution) confirmed that CVE-2024-32896 “is the 2nd part of the fix for CVE-2024-29748 vulnerability” which are being actively exploited in the wild by forensic companies. Additionally GrapheneOS notes that “none of this is actually Pixel specific.”

jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-04T15:10:02.000Z ##

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-03T18:38:08.437Z ##

Android security advisory: Android Security Bulletin—September 2024
Don't shit your pants like I did when I saw "Note: There are indications that CVE-2024-32896 may be under limited, targeted exploitation." and thought A GODDAMN ZERO-DAY. Well yes, but actually no: CVE-2024-32896 (7.8 high) Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability was disclosed back on 11 June 2024. This apparently is a backporting of that patch to the rest of Android.
Don't forget to check out the following updated security bulletins:

  • Pixel Update Bulletin—September 2024
  • Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin—September 2024
  • Wear OS Security Bulletin—September 2024
  • No Pixel Watch (at this time)

No mention of exploitation (of anything new)

#PatchTuesday #Android #vulnerability #CVE

Android security advisory: Android Security Bulletin—September 2024
Don't shit your pants like I did when I saw "Note: There are indications that CVE-2024-32896 may be under limited, targeted exploitation." and thought A GODDAMN ZERO-DAY. Well yes, but actually no: CVE-2024-32896 (7.8 high) Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability was disclosed back on 11 June 2024. This apparently is a backporting of that patch to the rest of Android.
Don't forget to check out the following updated security bulletins:

  • Pixel Update Bulletin—September 2024
  • Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin—September 2024
  • Wear OS Security Bulletin—September 2024
  • No Pixel Watch (at this time)

##

CVE-2024-5274
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.35%

updated 2024-08-14T17:07:13.270000

5 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.112 allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

2 repos

https://github.com/mistymntncop/CVE-2024-5274

https://github.com/Alchemist3dot14/CVE-2024-5274-Detection

avolha at 2024-09-07T11:54:56.820Z ##

Okazało się, że powiązana z rosyjskim rządem grupa APT29, znana też jako Midnight Blizzard czy Cozy Bear, od listopada 2023 r. do lipca 2024 r. korzystała z exploitów na iOS i Androida zaskakująco podobnych do tych, które opracowali komercyjni producenci oprogramowania szpiegującego, tacy jak NSO Group i Intellexa (pierwszy stworzył Pegasusa, drugi Predatora).

Najpierw atakujący włamali się na strony cabinet.gov[.]mn i mfa.gov[.]mn należące do władz Mongolii i posługując się techniką wodopoju (ang. watering hole), dostarczali użytkownikom exploit wykorzystujący lukę CVE-2023-41993 w silniku WebKit na platformie iOS 16.6.1 i starszych. Atak koncentrował się na kradzieży ciasteczek. W kolejnej kampanii grupa zaktualizowała zresztą listę interesujących ją docelowych stron. Według ekspertów niemal identyczny exploit został użyty we wrześniu 2023 r. w oprogramowaniu firmy Intellexa.

Ostatnia opisana w raporcie kampania skupiała się już na użytkownikach Androida. W tym przypadku atakujący posłużyli się exploitami wykorzystującymi podatności CVE-2024-5274 i CVE-2024-4671 w przeglądarce Google Chrome. Badacze ustalili, że exploit na pierwszą z wymienionych luk był podobny do stosowanego przez NSO Group w maju 2024 r., choć koncepcyjnie trochę się od niego różnił. Drugi exploit wykazywał wiele podobieństw do tych, które w przeszłości stworzyła Intellexa.

Badacze nie są pewni, w jaki sposób APT29 uzyskała dostęp do exploitów używanych wcześniej jedynie przez komercyjnych dostawców narzędzi nadzoru. Nie jest wykluczone, że zostały one kupione od brokera luk, który najpierw sprzedał je firmom NSO Group i Intellexa jako 0-dniowe.

Cała analiza: https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/state-backed-attackers-and-commercial-surveillance-vendors-repeatedly-use-the-same-exploits/

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #apt29 #nsogroup #intellexa

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-04T15:39:13.842Z ##

@campuscodi For reference: CVE-2024-5274 (8.8 high, disclosed 28 may 2024 by Google, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is a Type Confusion vulnerability in V8 (JavaScript engine) in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.112 which allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page.

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-08-30T08:22:38.636Z ##

Russia Backed APT-29 is actively exploiting Google Chrome zero-day vulnerability CVE-2024-5274.

Source: https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/state-backed-attackers-and-commercial-surveillance-vendors-repeatedly-use-the-same-exploits/

#cybersecurity #infosec #PatchNOW

##
avolha@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-07T11:54:56.000Z ##

Okazało się, że powiązana z rosyjskim rządem grupa APT29, znana też jako Midnight Blizzard czy Cozy Bear, od listopada 2023 r. do lipca 2024 r. korzystała z exploitów na iOS i Androida zaskakująco podobnych do tych, które opracowali komercyjni producenci oprogramowania szpiegującego, tacy jak NSO Group i Intellexa (pierwszy stworzył Pegasusa, drugi Predatora).

Najpierw atakujący włamali się na strony cabinet.gov[.]mn i mfa.gov[.]mn należące do władz Mongolii i posługując się techniką wodopoju (ang. watering hole), dostarczali użytkownikom exploit wykorzystujący lukę CVE-2023-41993 w silniku WebKit na platformie iOS 16.6.1 i starszych. Atak koncentrował się na kradzieży ciasteczek. W kolejnej kampanii grupa zaktualizowała zresztą listę interesujących ją docelowych stron. Według ekspertów niemal identyczny exploit został użyty we wrześniu 2023 r. w oprogramowaniu firmy Intellexa.

Ostatnia opisana w raporcie kampania skupiała się już na użytkownikach Androida. W tym przypadku atakujący posłużyli się exploitami wykorzystującymi podatności CVE-2024-5274 i CVE-2024-4671 w przeglądarce Google Chrome. Badacze ustalili, że exploit na pierwszą z wymienionych luk był podobny do stosowanego przez NSO Group w maju 2024 r., choć koncepcyjnie trochę się od niego różnił. Drugi exploit wykazywał wiele podobieństw do tych, które w przeszłości stworzyła Intellexa.

Badacze nie są pewni, w jaki sposób APT29 uzyskała dostęp do exploitów używanych wcześniej jedynie przez komercyjnych dostawców narzędzi nadzoru. Nie jest wykluczone, że zostały one kupione od brokera luk, który najpierw sprzedał je firmom NSO Group i Intellexa jako 0-dniowe.

Cała analiza: https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/state-backed-attackers-and-commercial-surveillance-vendors-repeatedly-use-the-same-exploits/

#infosec #cyberbezpieczenstwo #apt29 #nsogroup #intellexa

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T15:39:13.000Z ##

@campuscodi For reference: CVE-2024-5274 (8.8 high, disclosed 28 may 2024 by Google, added to CISA's KEV Catalog same day) is a Type Confusion vulnerability in V8 (JavaScript engine) in Google Chrome prior to 125.0.6422.112 which allowed a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code inside a sandbox via a crafted HTML page.

##

CVE-2024-4671
(9.6 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.10%

updated 2024-08-14T17:06:43.910000

2 posts

Use after free in Visuals in Google Chrome prior to 124.0.6367.201 allowed a remote attacker who had compromised the renderer process to potentially perform a sandbox escape via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

avolha at 2024-09-07T11:54:56.820Z ##

Okazało się, że powiązana z rosyjskim rządem grupa APT29, znana też jako Midnight Blizzard czy Cozy Bear, od listopada 2023 r. do lipca 2024 r. korzystała z exploitów na iOS i Androida zaskakująco podobnych do tych, które opracowali komercyjni producenci oprogramowania szpiegującego, tacy jak NSO Group i Intellexa (pierwszy stworzył Pegasusa, drugi Predatora).

Najpierw atakujący włamali się na strony cabinet.gov[.]mn i mfa.gov[.]mn należące do władz Mongolii i posługując się techniką wodopoju (ang. watering hole), dostarczali użytkownikom exploit wykorzystujący lukę CVE-2023-41993 w silniku WebKit na platformie iOS 16.6.1 i starszych. Atak koncentrował się na kradzieży ciasteczek. W kolejnej kampanii grupa zaktualizowała zresztą listę interesujących ją docelowych stron. Według ekspertów niemal identyczny exploit został użyty we wrześniu 2023 r. w oprogramowaniu firmy Intellexa.

Ostatnia opisana w raporcie kampania skupiała się już na użytkownikach Androida. W tym przypadku atakujący posłużyli się exploitami wykorzystującymi podatności CVE-2024-5274 i CVE-2024-4671 w przeglądarce Google Chrome. Badacze ustalili, że exploit na pierwszą z wymienionych luk był podobny do stosowanego przez NSO Group w maju 2024 r., choć koncepcyjnie trochę się od niego różnił. Drugi exploit wykazywał wiele podobieństw do tych, które w przeszłości stworzyła Intellexa.

Badacze nie są pewni, w jaki sposób APT29 uzyskała dostęp do exploitów używanych wcześniej jedynie przez komercyjnych dostawców narzędzi nadzoru. Nie jest wykluczone, że zostały one kupione od brokera luk, który najpierw sprzedał je firmom NSO Group i Intellexa jako 0-dniowe.

updated 2024-08-14T16:58:53.233000

2 posts

there is a possible way to bypass due to a logic error in the code. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is needed for exploitation.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-04T18:11:48.617Z ##

@happygeek it's a bit late to include this information since you already published it but GrapheneOS Foundation, a Canadian non-profit (privacy-enhanced and security-focused Android distribution) confirmed that CVE-2024-32896 “is the 2nd part of the fix for CVE-2024-29748 vulnerability” which are being actively exploited in the wild by forensic companies. Additionally GrapheneOS notes that “none of this is actually Pixel specific.”

Additionally GrapheneOS notes that “none of this is actually Pixel specific.”

RARLAB WinRAR before 6.23 allows attackers to execute arbitrary code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive. screaminggoat at 2024-09-02T13:32:45.168Z ##

Kaspersky: Head Mare: adventures of a unicorn in Russia and Belarus
Reference: CVE-2023-38831 (7.8 high, disclosed 23 August 2023 by Group-IB as exploited in the wild by cybercriminals, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 August 2023, has proof of concept) RARLAB WinRAR Code Execution Vulnerability.

So Head Mare is a hacktivist group that's been active since 2023 and exclusively targets companies in Russia and Belarus. (sus) They conduct phishing campaigns distributing RAR archives that leverage CVE-2023-38831 for initial acess. Some of the discovered tools overlap with previously investigated groups attacking Russian organizations. They deploy LockBit for Windows and Babuk for Linux (ESXi) ransomware. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #headmare #hacktivism #russia #belarus #ransomware #lockbit #babuk #CVE_2023_38831 #rar #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2023-22527
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.09%

updated 2024-08-14T15:23:20.770000

7 posts

A template injection vulnerability on older versions of Confluence Data Center and Server allows an unauthenticated attacker to achieve RCE on an affected instance. Customers using an affected version must take immediate action. Most recent supported versions of Confluence Data Center and Server are not affected by this vulnerability as it was ultimately mitigated during regular version updates.

Godzilla Fileless Backdoor Exploits Atlassian Confluence Vulnerability CVE-2023-22527 https://cybersecuritynews.com/godzilla-fileless-backdoor-exploits/ #CyberSecurityNews #cybersecuritynews #CyberSecurity #Vulnerability #cybersecurity #vulnerability

##
VirusBulletin at 2024-09-02T09:28:23.145Z ##

Trend Micro researchers have identified a new attack vector that exploits CVE-2023-22527 through the deployment of an in-memory fileless backdoor known as the Godzilla webshell. https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/24/h/godzilla-fileless-backdoors.html

##
screaminggoat at 2024-08-30T13:05:57.210Z ##

Trend Micro: Silent Intrusions: Godzilla Fileless Backdoors Targeting Atlassian Confluence
Reference: CVE-2023-22527 (CNA: 10.0/NVD: 9.8 critical, disclosed 16 January 2024 by Atlassian, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 January 2024) Atlassian Confluence Data Center and Server Template Injection Vulnerability (RCE)

Not even two days later, Trend Micro reports more CVE-2024-22527 exploitation. This time, a loader leads to an in-memory fileless backdoor known as the Godzilla webshell. The original malware author claims that Godzilla avoids detection by using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption for its network traffic and boasts a very low static detection rate across various security vendor products. Trend Micro describes the infection chain and shares IOC.

#threatintel #godzilla #backdoor #CVE_2023_22527 #Atlassian #Confluence #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-42154
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.38%

updated 2024-08-08T15:02:01.050000

1 posts

In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: tcp_metrics: validate source addr length I don't see anything checking that TCP_METRICS_ATTR_SADDR_IPV4 is at least 4 bytes long, and the policy doesn't have an entry for this attribute at all (neither does it for IPv6 but v6 is manually validated).

strugee@tech.lgbt at 2024-09-04T22:31:17.000Z ##

even by the _specially_ low standards by which I judge #linuxkernel CVEs, the description for https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-42154 is actual trash and honestly borderline worse than nothing

##

CVE-2024-32113
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 90.41%

updated 2024-08-08T13:38:57.533000

9 posts

Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Apache OFBiz.This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.13. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.13, which fixes the issue.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:16:22.115Z ##

Cyble: The Re-Emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks (emailwall)
Let me save you the click: the attacker IOC is 185[.]190[.]24[.]111. I don't get why they added a "give us your personal contact information for more technical details," this is a security worst practice.

Cyble reports exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-32113, and emphasized that the assigning of CVE-2024-45195 (which Rapid7 claims is a patch bypass for multiple CVEs with the same underlying issue which I believe is "permission check for ProgramExport and EntitySQLProcessor") resulted in more exploitation attempts.

References:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to KEV Catalog 07 August 2024) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution

#CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_45195 #apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.059Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T15:16:22.000Z ##

Cyble: The Re-Emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks (emailwall)
Let me save you the click: the attacker IOC is 185[.]190[.]24[.]111. I don't get why they added a "give us your personal contact information for more technical details," this is a security worst practice.

Cyble reports exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-32113, and emphasized that the assigning of CVE-2024-45195 (which Rapid7 claims is a patch bypass for multiple CVEs with the same underlying issue which I believe is "permission check for ProgramExport and EntitySQLProcessor") resulted in more exploitation attempts.

References:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to KEV Catalog 07 August 2024) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution

#CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_45195 #apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##

CVE-2024-37018
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.00%

updated 2024-08-05T16:35:12.763000

2 posts

The OpenDaylight 0.15.3 controller allows topology poisoning via API requests because an application can manipulate the path that is taken by discovery packets.

arXiv_csCR_bot@mastoxiv.page at 2024-09-02T06:53:07.000Z ##

Manipulating OpenFlow Link Discovery Packet Forwarding for Topology Poisoning

Mingming Chen, Thomas La Porta, Teryl Taylor, Frederico Araujo, Trent Jaeger
https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.16940 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2408.16940 https://arxiv.org/html/2408.16940

arXiv:2408.16940v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: Software-defined networking (SDN) is a centralized, dynamic, and programmable network management technology that enables flexible traffic control and scalability. SDN facilitates network administration through a centralized view of the underlying physical topology; tampering with this topology view can result in catastrophic damage to network management and security. To underscore this issue, we introduce Marionette, a new topology poisoning technique that manipulates OpenFlow link discovery packet forwarding to alter topology information. Our approach exposes an overlooked yet widespread attack vector, distinguishing itself from traditional link fabrication attacks that tamper, spoof, or relay discovery packets at the data plane. Unlike localized attacks observed in existing methods, our technique introduces a globalized topology poisoning attack that leverages control privileges. Marionette implements a reinforcement learning algorithm to compute a poisoned topology target, and injects flow entries to achieve a long-lived stealthy attack. Our evaluation shows that Marionette successfully attacks five open-source controllers and nine OpenFlow-based discovery protocols. Marionette overcomes the state-of-the-art topology poisoning defenses, showcasing a new class of topology poisoning that initiates on the control plane. This security vulnerability was ethically disclosed to OpenDaylight, and CVE-2024-37018 has been assigned.

##
arXiv_csCR_bot@mastoxiv.page at 2024-09-02T06:53:07.000Z ##

Manipulating OpenFlow Link Discovery Packet Forwarding for Topology Poisoning

Mingming Chen, Thomas La Porta, Teryl Taylor, Frederico Araujo, Trent Jaeger
https://arxiv.org/abs/2408.16940 https://arxiv.org/pdf/2408.16940 https://arxiv.org/html/2408.16940

arXiv:2408.16940v1 Announce Type: new
Abstract: Software-defined networking (SDN) is a centralized, dynamic, and programmable network management technology that enables flexible traffic control and scalability. SDN facilitates network administration through a centralized view of the underlying physical topology; tampering with this topology view can result in catastrophic damage to network management and security. To underscore this issue, we introduce Marionette, a new topology poisoning technique that manipulates OpenFlow link discovery packet forwarding to alter topology information. Our approach exposes an overlooked yet widespread attack vector, distinguishing itself from traditional link fabrication attacks that tamper, spoof, or relay discovery packets at the data plane. Unlike localized attacks observed in existing methods, our technique introduces a globalized topology poisoning attack that leverages control privileges. Marionette implements a reinforcement learning algorithm to compute a poisoned topology target, and injects flow entries to achieve a long-lived stealthy attack. Our evaluation shows that Marionette successfully attacks five open-source controllers and nine OpenFlow-based discovery protocols. Marionette overcomes the state-of-the-art topology poisoning defenses, showcasing a new class of topology poisoning that initiates on the control plane. This security vulnerability was ethically disclosed to OpenDaylight, and CVE-2024-37018 has been assigned.

##

CVE-2024-6387
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 71.47%

updated 2024-07-30T02:15:08.387000

2 posts

A security regression (CVE-2006-5051) was discovered in OpenSSH's server (sshd). There is a race condition which can lead sshd to handle some signals in an unsafe manner. An unauthenticated, remote attacker may be able to trigger it by failing to authenticate within a set time period.

faker at 2024-09-09T15:07:16.551Z ##

It's always amazing how terrible some Nessus checks are.
It's like they never even heard of backported security patches.

Oh, your OpenSSH server reports 'OpenSSH_8.9p1 Ubuntu-3ubuntu0.10'? Well, 8.9 is clearly smaller than 9.8 so you MUST be vulnerable to CVE-2024-6387!

And sometimes I get it, the version just appears as outdated. But Ubuntu even includes enough information in the version string to make it possible to detect it automatically as fully patched.

##
faker@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T15:07:16.000Z ##

It's always amazing how terrible some Nessus checks are.
It's like they never even heard of backported security patches.

Oh, your OpenSSH server reports 'OpenSSH_8.9p1 Ubuntu-3ubuntu0.10'? Well, 8.9 is clearly smaller than 9.8 so you MUST be vulnerable to CVE-2024-6387!

And sometimes I get it, the version just appears as outdated. But Ubuntu even includes enough information in the version string to make it possible to detect it automatically as fully patched.

CVE-2017-0144
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 96.40%

updated 2024-07-24T16:03:46.547000

4 posts

The SMBv1 server in Microsoft Windows Vista SP2; Windows Server 2008 SP2 and R2 SP1; Windows 7 SP1; Windows 8.1; Windows Server 2012 Gold and R2; Windows RT 8.1; and Windows 10 Gold, 1511, and 1607; and Windows Server 2016 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted packets, aka "Windows SMB Remote Code Execution Vulnerability." This vulnerability is different from those describe

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T16:50:59.075Z ##

ESET: CosmicBeetle steps up: Probation period at RansomHub
ESET reports on CosmicBeetle, a financially-motivated threat actor which targets small to medium businesses (SMB) worldwide, assessed with medium confidence to be a new affiliate of RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) as well as Lockbit. CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)
  • CVE-2023-27532 (a vulnerability in a Veeam Backup & Replication component)
  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac
  • CVE-2022-42475 (a vulnerability in FortiOS SSL-VPN)
  • CVE-2020-1472 (aka Zerologon)

IOC provided. See related The Hacker News reporting: CosmicBeetle Deploys Custom ScRansom Ransomware, Partnering with RansomHub

#threatintel #cosmicbeetle #vulnerability #eitw #ransomware #infosec #IOC #ransomhub #lockbit #raas #ScRansom #cybersecurity

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-10T12:13:48.981Z ##

The gang uses custom tools known as the Spacecolon malware family, and deploys them after gaining access to a network through brute-force methods as well as exploiting older vulnerabilities like EternalBlue (CVE-2017-0144) or ZeroLogon (CVE-2020-1472). https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/noname-ransomware-gang-deploying-ransomhub-malware-in-recent-attacks/

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T16:50:59.000Z ##

ESET: CosmicBeetle steps up: Probation period at RansomHub
ESET reports on CosmicBeetle, a financially-motivated threat actor which targets small to medium businesses (SMB) worldwide, assessed with medium confidence to be a new affiliate of RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) as well as Lockbit. CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)
  • CVE-2023-27532 (a vulnerability in a Veeam Backup & Replication component)
  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac
  • CVE-2022-42475 (a vulnerability in FortiOS SSL-VPN)
  • CVE-2020-1472 (aka Zerologon)

IOC provided. See related The Hacker News reporting: CosmicBeetle Deploys Custom ScRansom Ransomware, Partnering with RansomHub

CVE-2024-36401
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.88%

updated 2024-07-16T01:00:01.567000

5 posts

GeoServer is an open source server that allows users to share and edit geospatial data. Prior to versions 2.23.6, 2.24.4, and 2.25.2, multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. The GeoTools library API that GeoServ

Nuclei template

threatcodex at 2024-09-09T18:44:54.411Z ##

Threat Actors Exploit GeoServer Vulnerability CVE-2024-36401
#CVE_2024_36401 #SideWalk #GOREVERSE #JenX #Condi
https://www.fortinet.com/blog/threat-research/threat-actors-exploit-geoserver-vulnerability-cve-2024-36401

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T14:55:36.784Z ##

Fortinet Threat Actors Exploit GeoServer Vulnerability CVE-2024-36401
References:

  • CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 July 2024) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 RCE

Fortinet observed multiple campaigns targeting CVE-2024-36401, including a malicious tool called GOREVERSE that often functions as a reverse proxy server. SideWalk is a Linux backdoor often linked with the hacking group APT41. There's also a Mirai botnet variant called JenX (This malware has a credential list for brute-force attacks and a hard-coded payload related to the Huawei router vulnerability CVE-2017-17215), the Condi botnet, and several CoinMiner cryptomining operations. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_36401 #GeoServer #GOREVERSE #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #vulnerability #cryptomining

CVE-2024-5535
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-07-12T14:15:16.790000

2 posts

Issue summary: Calling the OpenSSL API function SSL_select_next_proto with an empty supported client protocols buffer may cause a crash or memory contents to be sent to the peer. Impact summary: A buffer overread can have a range of potential consequences such as unexpected application beahviour or a crash. In particular this issue could result in up to 255 bytes of arbitrary private data from me

CVE-2021-42287
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.63%

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T16:50:59.075Z ##

ESET: CosmicBeetle steps up: Probation period at RansomHub
ESET reports on CosmicBeetle, a financially-motivated threat actor which targets small to medium businesses (SMB) worldwide, assessed with medium confidence to be a new affiliate of RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) as well as Lockbit. CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)
  • CVE-2023-27532 (a vulnerability in a Veeam Backup & Replication component)
  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac
  • CVE-2022-42475 (a vulnerability in FortiOS SSL-VPN)
  • CVE-2020-1472 (aka Zerologon)

IOC provided. See related The Hacker News reporting: CosmicBeetle Deploys Custom ScRansom Ransomware, Partnering with RansomHub

#threatintel #cosmicbeetle #vulnerability #eitw #ransomware #infosec #IOC #ransomhub #lockbit #raas #ScRansom #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T16:50:59.000Z ##

CVE-2024-36104
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.06%

updated 2024-07-03T02:02:48.717000

5 posts

Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Apache OFBiz. This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.14. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.14, which fixes the issue.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.059Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-06T05:22:46.584Z ##

CVE-2024-45195 :: Forced Browsing vulnerability in Apache OfBiz.. #PatchNOW

Advisory:

https://lists.apache.org/thread/o90dd9lbk1hh3t2557t2y2qvrh92p7wy

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OFBIZ-13130

RApid7 Blog:

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/05/cve-2024-45195-apache-ofbiz-unauthenticated-remote-code-execution-fixed/

Patch Download and Release Information:

https://ofbiz.apache.org/download.html

Note: This is a patch bypass for PREVIOUSLY EXPLOITED vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104 and CVE-2024-38856.
