CVE-2022-42475
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 27.42%

updated 2024-06-28T13:48:44.240000

2 posts

A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability [CWE-122] in FortiOS SSL-VPN 7.2.0 through 7.2.2, 7.0.0 through 7.0.8, 6.4.0 through 6.4.10, 6.2.0 through 6.2.11, 6.0.15 and earlier and FortiProxy SSL-VPN 7.2.0 through 7.2.1, 7.0.7 and earlier may allow a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code or commands via specifically crafted requests.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T16:50:59.075Z ##

ESET: CosmicBeetle steps up: Probation period at RansomHub
ESET reports on CosmicBeetle, a financially-motivated threat actor which targets small to medium businesses (SMB) worldwide, assessed with medium confidence to be a new affiliate of RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) as well as Lockbit. CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)
  • CVE-2023-27532 (a vulnerability in a Veeam Backup & Replication component)
  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac
  • CVE-2022-42475 (a vulnerability in FortiOS SSL-VPN)
  • CVE-2020-1472 (aka Zerologon)

IOC provided. See related The Hacker News reporting: CosmicBeetle Deploys Custom ScRansom Ransomware, Partnering with RansomHub

CVE-2023-36884
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 6.77%

updated 2024-06-27T18:59:51.030000

2 posts

Windows Search Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-08-30T13:19:06.505Z ##

Fortinet: Ransomware Roundup - Underground
Fortinet provides a threat actor spotlight on Underground Ransomware, concentrating on their attack chain. Initial infection is the exploitation of CVE-2023-36884 (7.5 high, disclosed 11 July 2023 by Microsoft, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 17 July 2024) Windows Search Remote Code Execution Vulnerability. The group may also use other common infection vectors such as email and purchasing access from an Initial Access Broker (IAB). Fortinet describes the ransom note, victimology and data leak site. IOC are provided.

#threatintel #underground #ransomware #cybercrime #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-30078
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-06-21T19:48:29.993000

5 posts

Windows Wi-Fi Driver Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

joxean@mastodon.social at 2024-09-06T08:34:35.000Z ##

I have just stumbled upon this post diffing some windows driver:

https://www.crowdfense.com/windows-wi-fi-driver-rce-vulnerability-cve-2024-30078/

Why use #BinDiff and see this [first picture] when you can use #Diaphora and see this [second picture]?

Of course, feel free to use whatever tool you prefer but, what's the point of doing more work? Diaphora finds out that only 2 functions are interesting for patch diffing and shows exactly, in the pseudo-code, what new chunk of code was added and what new function is being called. Diffing decompilation.

##
itm4n at 2024-09-06T07:13:47.005Z ##

##
antenna@well.com at 2024-09-06T04:50:21.000Z ##

"A new critical cybersecurity threat has been discovered by CYFIRMA Research, involving a severe remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-30078. This flaw affects the Wi-Fi drivers in multiple versions of Microsoft Windows, posing a potential risk to over 1.6 billion active devices worldwide" - https://www.techradar.com/pro/critical-remote-code-execution-vulnerability-discovered-in-microsoft-windows-wi-fi-drivers

updated 2024-06-17T12:42:04.623000

The Gutenberg Blocks with AI by Kadence WP – Page Builder Features plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘titleFont’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.2.38 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in page

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:10:50.860Z ##

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

#fortinet #vulnerability #cve #fortios #forticlient

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

##

CVE-2023-32031
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 9.78%

updated 2024-05-29T02:15:47.617000

2 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T16:29:33.983Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 1 - MultiValuedProperty
This is part 1 of a series of Exchange-related blogs. @chudypb describes CVE-2023-21529 and CVE-2023-32031 (both 8.8 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution vulnerabilities. CVE-2023-21529 is the abuse of the allowed MultiValuedProperty class, while CVE-2023-32031 is the bypass for CVE-2023-21529, abusing the not blocked Command class. He abused both the allow-listed and deny-listed classes to achieve RCE on Exchange. Not only that, he still had two additional full-RCE chains that he was able to deliver after the CVE-2023-32031 patch.

#ZDI #vulnerability #proxynotshell #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-05T16:29:33.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 1 - MultiValuedProperty
This is part 1 of a series of Exchange-related blogs. @chudypb describes CVE-2023-21529 and CVE-2023-32031 (both 8.8 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution vulnerabilities. CVE-2023-21529 is the abuse of the allowed MultiValuedProperty class, while CVE-2023-32031 is the bypass for CVE-2023-21529, abusing the not blocked Command class. He abused both the allow-listed and deny-listed classes to achieve RCE on Exchange. Not only that, he still had two additional full-RCE chains that he was able to deliver after the CVE-2023-32031 patch.

#ZDI #vulnerability #proxynotshell #cve

##

CVE-2023-21529
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 1.39%

updated 2024-05-29T02:15:14.670000

4 posts

Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution Vulnerability

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T16:29:33.983Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 1 - MultiValuedProperty
This is part 1 of a series of Exchange-related blogs. @chudypb describes CVE-2023-21529 and CVE-2023-32031 (both 8.8 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution vulnerabilities. CVE-2023-21529 is the abuse of the allowed MultiValuedProperty class, while CVE-2023-32031 is the bypass for CVE-2023-21529, abusing the not blocked Command class. He abused both the allow-listed and deny-listed classes to achieve RCE on Exchange. Not only that, he still had two additional full-RCE chains that he was able to deliver after the CVE-2023-32031 patch.

#ZDI #vulnerability #proxynotshell #cve

##
thezdi at 2024-09-05T15:44:20.527Z ##

In the 1st of a 4 part series, @chudypb details his research into exploiting #Microsoft #Exchange after ProxyNotShell was patched. Today's post covers CVE-2023-21529: abuse of the allowed MultiValuedProperty class for RCE. Check it out at https://www.zerodayinitiative.com/blog/2024/9/4/exploiting-exchange-powershell-after-proxynotshell-part-1-multivaluedproperty

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-05T16:29:33.000Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: Exploiting Exchange PowerShell After ProxyNotShell: Part 1 - MultiValuedProperty
This is part 1 of a series of Exchange-related blogs. @chudypb describes CVE-2023-21529 and CVE-2023-32031 (both 8.8 high) Microsoft Exchange Server Remote Code Execution vulnerabilities. CVE-2023-21529 is the abuse of the allowed MultiValuedProperty class, while CVE-2023-32031 is the bypass for CVE-2023-21529, abusing the not blocked Command class. He abused both the allow-listed and deny-listed classes to achieve RCE on Exchange. Not only that, he still had two additional full-RCE chains that he was able to deliver after the CVE-2023-32031 patch.

#ZDI #vulnerability #proxynotshell #cve

##
thezdi@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-05T15:44:20.000Z ##

CVE-2020-1472
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 42.20%

updated 2024-05-23T17:56:29.137000

4 posts

An elevation of privilege vulnerability exists when an attacker establishes a vulnerable Netlogon secure channel connection to a domain controller, using the Netlogon Remote Protocol (MS-NRPC). An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could run a specially crafted application on a device on the network. To exploit the vulnerability, an unauthenticated attacker would be required to

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T16:50:59.075Z ##

ESET: CosmicBeetle steps up: Probation period at RansomHub
ESET reports on CosmicBeetle, a financially-motivated threat actor which targets small to medium businesses (SMB) worldwide, assessed with medium confidence to be a new affiliate of RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) as well as Lockbit. CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)
  • CVE-2023-27532 (a vulnerability in a Veeam Backup & Replication component)
  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac
  • CVE-2022-42475 (a vulnerability in FortiOS SSL-VPN)
  • CVE-2020-1472 (aka Zerologon)

IOC provided. See related The Hacker News reporting: CosmicBeetle Deploys Custom ScRansom Ransomware, Partnering with RansomHub

#threatintel #cosmicbeetle #vulnerability #eitw #ransomware #infosec #IOC #ransomhub #lockbit #raas #ScRansom #cybersecurity

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-10T12:13:48.981Z ##

The gang uses custom tools known as the Spacecolon malware family, and deploys them after gaining access to a network through brute-force methods as well as exploiting older vulnerabilities like EternalBlue (CVE-2017-0144) or ZeroLogon (CVE-2020-1472). https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/noname-ransomware-gang-deploying-ransomhub-malware-in-recent-attacks/

CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)

  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac

Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to universal cross site scripting. Apple is aware of a report that this issue may have been actively exploited..

LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-08-30T10:16:40.000Z ##

Russian cyber operators ('government hackers') were using tools that were identical or very similar to those previously created by spyware tool makers Intellex and NSO Group. It is not known how the Russians acquired these tools. The operations detected were aimed at spying on Mongolian government. Data was stolen, such as cookies from the Safari browser (CVE-2021-1879). https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/state-backed-attackers-and-commercial-surveillance-vendors-repeatedly-use-the-same-exploits/

##
LukaszOlejnik@mastodon.social at 2024-08-30T10:16:40.000Z ##

Russian cyber operators ('government hackers') were using tools that were identical or very similar to those previously created by spyware tool makers Intellex and NSO Group. It is not known how the Russians acquired these tools. The operations detected were aimed at spying on Mongolian government. Data was stolen, such as cookies from the Safari browser (CVE-2021-1879). https://blog.google/threat-analysis-group/state-backed-attackers-and-commercial-surveillance-vendors-repeatedly-use-the-same-exploits/

CVE-2023-27532
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 3.08%

updated 2024-05-09T18:37:54.573000

6 posts

Vulnerability in Veeam Backup & Replication component allows encrypted credentials stored in the configuration database to be obtained. This may lead to gaining access to the backup infrastructure hosts.

1 repos

#search_error

itm4n at 2024-09-10T17:24:27.608Z ##

Cool blog post by my colleague @plopz0r !!!

"Getting code execution on Veeam through CVE-2023-27532"

👉 https://blog.scrt.ch/2024/09/10/getting-code-execution-on-veeam-through-cve-2023-27532/

This post has been awaiting publication for a loooooong time, at Veeam's request, but now that Watchtowr released their own detailed writeup, mainly describing the RCE found by my colleague a while ago, we decided to move forward and release it.

BTW, for a reason I ignore, he was not credited by Veeam (KB4649) for this discovery. I assume it's just an oversight on their end. :eyes: It's possible that it's a duplicate, but I have a hard time believing that he was not the first one to report this vulnerability given the timeline.

#cve_2024_40711 #veeam #cve #rce #windows #CVE_2023_27532

ESET: CosmicBeetle steps up: Probation period at RansomHub
ESET reports on CosmicBeetle, a financially-motivated threat actor which targets small to medium businesses (SMB) worldwide, assessed with medium confidence to be a new affiliate of RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) as well as Lockbit. CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)
  • CVE-2023-27532 (a vulnerability in a Veeam Backup & Replication component)
  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac
  • CVE-2022-42475 (a vulnerability in FortiOS SSL-VPN)

CVE-2024-3094
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 14.45%

updated 2024-05-01T19:15:27.340000

2 posts

Malicious code was discovered in the upstream tarballs of xz, starting with version 5.6.0. Through a series of complex obfuscations, the liblzma build process extracts a prebuilt object file from a disguised test file existing in the source code, which is then used to modify specific functions in the liblzma code. This results in a modified liblzma library that can be used by any software linked

Nuclei template

sparfindig@digitalcourage.social at 2024-09-05T04:37:33.000Z ##

Neues Video von #Simplicissimus: „Eine Gruppe Hacker hätte sich beinahe Zugang zu Millionen von Servern auf der ganzen Welt verschafft. Doch ein deutscher Software-Entwickler hat ihnen einen Strich durch die Rechnung gemacht.“
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8p8PHeGg--U
Hintergrund: https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/CVE-2024-3094

##

CVE-2023-48795
(5.9 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 96.53%

updated 2024-05-01T18:15:10.657000

1 posts

The SSH transport protocol with certain OpenSSH extensions, found in OpenSSH before 9.6 and other products, allows remote attackers to bypass integrity checks such that some packets are omitted (from the extension negotiation message), and a client and server may consequently end up with a connection for which some security features have been downgraded or disabled, aka a Terrapin attack. This occ

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

TomSellers@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-29T16:27:28.000Z ##

For folks with Synology NAS gear that is a bit older but still new enough to support DSM 7.x:

Synology has released DSM 7.2.2-72803 to fix a bunch of bugs and at least 6 CVEs. One of those CVEs is CVE-2023-48795 which is the Terrapin vuln.

For older gear this will NOT show up in the updates list and will need to be manually downloaded and installed.

Release notes: https://www.synology.com/en-us/releaseNote/DSM

The link above includes a list of models requiring manual install as well as a link to the Download center.

#Security #Patches #Synology

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-01-23T19:31:32.413000

2 posts

An attacker with access to a Management Console user account with the editor role could escalate privileges through a command injection vulnerability in the Management Console. This vulnerability affected all versions of GitHub Enterprise Server and was fixed in versions 3.11.3, 3.10.5, 3.9.8, and 3.8.13 This vulnerability was reported via the GitHub Bug Bounty program.

A flaw was found in the Ceph RGW configuration with Beast as the front end handling client requests. An unauthenticated attacker could crash the Ceph RGW server by sending valid HTTP headers and terminating the connection, resulting in a remote denial of service for Ceph RGW clients.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-08T04:55:46.624Z ##

I found an exploited vulnerability that is missing from CISA's KEV Catalog: CVE-2019-16278 (CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical, assigned 14 October 2019) Nostromo 1.9.6 Directory Traversal/ Remote Command Execution.

  • U.S. Department of Justice press release from 16 September 2020 says that APT41 used it:
    > "However, they also employed publicly available exploits and tools, including the following common vulnerabilities and exposures (“CVE”): ...CVE-2019-16278..."
  • In a CISA cybersecurity advisory from 20 October 2020, Table 3: Patch information for vulnerabilities routinely exploited by Chinese APT actors, includes CVE-2019-16278.

cc: @todb @hrbrmstr

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-08T04:55:46.000Z ##

    > "However, they also employed publicly available exploits and tools, including the following common vulnerabilities and exposures (“CVE”): ...CVE-2019-16278..."
  • In a CISA cybersecurity advisory from 20 October 2020, Table 3: Patch information for vulnerabilities routinely exploited by Chinese APT actors, includes CVE-2019-16278.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-08T05:49:39.359Z ##

@todb @hrbrmstr Another missed exploited vulnerability is CVE-2021-44207 (CVSSv3.1: 8.1 high, assigned 21 December 2021) Acclaim USAHERDS Hard-Coded Credentials Vulnerability. This vulnerability is a fun one because according to Mandiant on 08 March 2022, it was exploited by the Chinese state-sponsored APT41 as a zero-day in the USAHerds web application, used by 18 states for animal health management.

CVE-2017-17215
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 79.22%

updated 2018-04-19T15:04:20.200000

2 posts

Huawei HG532 with some customized versions has a remote code execution vulnerability. An authenticated attacker could send malicious packets to port 37215 to launch attacks. Successful exploit could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-05T14:55:36.784Z ##

Fortinet Threat Actors Exploit GeoServer Vulnerability CVE-2024-36401
References:

  • CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 July 2024) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 RCE

Fortinet observed multiple campaigns targeting CVE-2024-36401, including a malicious tool called GOREVERSE that often functions as a reverse proxy server. SideWalk is a Linux backdoor often linked with the hacking group APT41. There's also a Mirai botnet variant called JenX (This malware has a credential list for brute-force attacks and a hard-coded payload related to the Huawei router vulnerability CVE-2017-17215), the Condi botnet, and several CoinMiner cryptomining operations. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_36401 #GeoServer #GOREVERSE #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #vulnerability #cryptomining

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-05T14:55:36.000Z ##

Fortinet Threat Actors Exploit GeoServer Vulnerability CVE-2024-36401
References:

  • CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 July 2024) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 RCE

Fortinet observed multiple campaigns targeting CVE-2024-36401, including a malicious tool called GOREVERSE that often functions as a reverse proxy server. SideWalk is a Linux backdoor often linked with the hacking group APT41. There's also a Mirai botnet variant called JenX (This malware has a credential list for brute-force attacks and a hard-coded payload related to the Huawei router vulnerability CVE-2017-17215), the Condi botnet, and several CoinMiner cryptomining operations. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_36401 #GeoServer #GOREVERSE #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #vulnerability #cryptomining

##

CVE-2011-4815
(0 None)

EPSS: 2.02%

updated 2017-08-29T01:30:35.443000

2 posts

Ruby (aka CRuby) before 1.8.7-p357 computes hash values without restricting the ability to trigger hash collisions predictably, which allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via crafted input to an application that maintains a hash table.

soaproot@sfba.social at 2024-09-08T20:38:12.000Z ##

@bascule The theory being that salting the hash (or whatever the word is for the fix found for example in the Ruby response to CVE-2011-4815) isn't a sufficient countermeasure because an attacker might be able to deduce the salt (for example by looking at response times)?

##
soaproot@sfba.social at 2024-09-08T20:38:12.000Z ##

@bascule The theory being that salting the hash (or whatever the word is for the fix found for example in the Ruby response to CVE-2011-4815) isn't a sufficient countermeasure because an attacker might be able to deduce the salt (for example by looking at response times)?

CVE-2024-44000
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

7 posts

N/A

1 repos

#search_error

decio at 2024-09-06T09:17:22.219Z ##

encore et encore...

🩹 LiteSpeed Release v6.5.0.1 ( chagelog https://plugins.trac.wordpress.org/changeset/3146657/litespeed-cache/trunk )

"Critical Account Takeover Vulnerability Patched in LiteSpeed Cache Plugin"
👇
https://patchstack.com/articles/critical-account-takeover-vulnerability-patched-in-litespeed-cache-plugin/
⬇️
"LiteSpeed Cache bug exposes 6 million WordPress sites to takeover attacks

Yet, another critical severity vulnerability has been discovered in LiteSpeed Cache, a caching plugin for speeding up user browsing in over 6 million WordPress sites.

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-44000 and categorized as an unauthenticated account takeover issue, was discovered by Patchstack's Rafie Muhammad on August 22, 2024. A fix was made available yesterday with the release of LiteSpeed Cache version 6.5.0.1."
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/litespeed-cache-bug-exposes-6-million-wordpress-sites-to-takeover-attacks/

#CyberVeille #WordPress #LiteSpeedCache #CVE_2024_44000

##

CVE-2024-41869
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

8 posts

N/A

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T18:21:26.766Z ##

Bleeping Computer: Adobe fixes Acrobat Reader zero-day with public PoC exploit
References:

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (10 September 2024)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

Okay I already have an EXPMON thread here (see parent toots above) so I'll orphan the original Adobe September 2024 Patch Tuesday toot. It should be noted that CVE-2024-41869 (7.8 high) UAF to arbitrary code execution in Adobe Acrobat and Reader is a Zero Day (Proof of Concept exploit in the wild exists before the vulnerability was patched, unknown if actually exploited). Apparently the August patch wasn't sufficient for the vulnerability CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high, which should also be considered a zero-day). Haifei Li wrote on the Bad Place: "We tested the (exactly the same) sample on the "patched" Adobe Reader version, it displayed additional dialogs, but if the user clicked/closed those dialogs, the app still crashed! Same UAF bug!"

In yesterday's Adobe Reader security advisory, Adobe didn't call attention to the fact that a Proof of Concept exploit exists in the wild, or however they would normally word it.

#expmon #adobe #proofofconcept #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_41869 #CVE_2024_39383

##

    • noteworthy: CVE-2024-41874 (9.8 critical) Deserialization of untrusted data
  • APSB24-72 Security update available for Adobe Photoshop (5 new)
  • APSB24-66 Security Updates Available for Adobe Illustrator (6 new)
  • APSB24-58 Security Updates Available for Adobe Premiere Pro (2 new)
  • APSB24-55 Security Updates Available for Adobe After Effects (5 new)
  • APSB24-54 Security Updates Available for Adobe Audition (2 new)
  • APSB24-53 Security Updates Available for Adobe Media Encoder (5 new)

##

CVE-2024-37285
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

4 posts

N/A

1 repos

#search_error

H3liumb0y at 2024-09-06T08:40:18.822Z ##

Critical Kibana Vulnerability - Arbitrary Code Execution via YAML Deserialization

Date: September 5, 2024

CVE: CVE-2024-37285

Vulnerability Type: Deserialization of Untrusted Data

CWE: [[CWE-502]]

Sources: Elastic Security Advisory

Synopsis

CVE-2024-37285 impacts Kibana versions 8.10.0 to 8.15.0, where a deserialization flaw allows remote code execution if an attacker injects malicious YAML payloads. This vulnerability requires that an attacker has elevated Elasticsearch and Kibana privileges.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability arises from improper YAML deserialization within Kibana. A malicious actor can craft a YAML payload and execute arbitrary code, provided they have specific Elasticsearch index and Kibana privileges. This issue affects Kibana from versions 8.10.0 through 8.15.0 and is critical due to its ease of exploitation and the potential for widespread impact.

Technical Key Findings

Attackers exploit this flaw by submitting a specially crafted YAML document that Kibana deserializes without proper validation. Once the malicious code is parsed, it can run on the server with elevated privileges, enabling arbitrary code execution.

The attacker must have the following Elasticsearch indices permissions;

  • write access to system indices .kibana_ingest*
  • The allow_restricted_indices flag needs to be set to true

The attacker must also have ANY of the following Kibana privileges;

  • Under Fleet the All privilege is granted
  • Under Integration the Read or All privilege is granted
  • Access to the fleet-setup privilege is gained through the Fleet Server’s service account token## Vulnerable Products
  • Kibana versions 8.10.0 to 8.15.0.

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands, leading to a complete system compromise. This could affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability, making it a high-risk issue for organizations relying on Kibana for data visualization and exploration.

Patches or Workaround

Upgrading to Kibana version 8.15.1 resolves this vulnerability. Additionally, limiting access to Elasticsearch indices and restricting Kibana privileges reduces exposure.

Tags

#CVE-2024-37285 #Kibana #ArbitraryCodeExecution #YAML #Deserialization #ElasticStack #CyberSecurity

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T03:27:30.420Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Kibana 8.15.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-27, ESA-2024-28)

  • CVE-2024-37288 (CVSSv3.1: 9.9 critical) Kibana arbitrary code execution via YAML deserialization in Amazon Bedrock Connector
  • CVE-2024-37285 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical) Kibana arbitrary code execution via YAML deserialization

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-37288 only affects users that use Elastic Security’s built-in AI tools 😂 and have configured an Amazon Bedrock connector.

#elastic #kibana #vulnerability #CVE

##
H3liumb0y@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T08:40:18.000Z ##

Critical Kibana Vulnerability - Arbitrary Code Execution via YAML Deserialization

Date: September 5, 2024

CVE: CVE-2024-37285

Vulnerability Type: Deserialization of Untrusted Data

CWE: [[CWE-502]]

Sources: Elastic Security Advisory

Synopsis

CVE-2024-37285 impacts Kibana versions 8.10.0 to 8.15.0, where a deserialization flaw allows remote code execution if an attacker injects malicious YAML payloads. This vulnerability requires that an attacker has elevated Elasticsearch and Kibana privileges.

Issue Summary

The vulnerability arises from improper YAML deserialization within Kibana. A malicious actor can craft a YAML payload and execute arbitrary code, provided they have specific Elasticsearch index and Kibana privileges. This issue affects Kibana from versions 8.10.0 through 8.15.0 and is critical due to its ease of exploitation and the potential for widespread impact.

Technical Key Findings

Attackers exploit this flaw by submitting a specially crafted YAML document that Kibana deserializes without proper validation. Once the malicious code is parsed, it can run on the server with elevated privileges, enabling arbitrary code execution.

The attacker must have the following Elasticsearch indices permissions;

  • write access to system indices .kibana_ingest*
  • The allow_restricted_indices flag needs to be set to true

The attacker must also have ANY of the following Kibana privileges;

  • Under Fleet the All privilege is granted
  • Under Integration the Read or All privilege is granted
  • Access to the fleet-setup privilege is gained through the Fleet Server’s service account token## Vulnerable Products
  • Kibana versions 8.10.0 to 8.15.0.

Impact Assessment

Successful exploitation could allow an attacker to execute arbitrary commands, leading to a complete system compromise. This could affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability, making it a high-risk issue for organizations relying on Kibana for data visualization and exploration.

Patches or Workaround

Upgrading to Kibana version 8.15.1 resolves this vulnerability. Additionally, limiting access to Elasticsearch indices and restricting Kibana privileges reduces exposure.

CVE-2024-20430
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-04T16:48:01.586Z ##

Cisco security advisories includes a zero-day:

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP
  • Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

EDIT: What @BleepingComputer took away out of this is that CVE-2024-20439 is a backdoor admin account: Cisco warns of backdoor admin account in Smart Licensing Utility

#zeroday #cisco #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20469 #cve #CVE_2024_20439

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T16:48:01.000Z ##

Cisco security advisories includes a zero-day:

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP
  • Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

EDIT: What @BleepingComputer took away out of this is that CVE-2024-20439 is a backdoor admin account: Cisco warns of backdoor admin account in Smart Licensing Utility

CVE-2024-22527
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.00%

2 posts

N/A

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-08-30T13:05:57.210Z ##

Trend Micro: Silent Intrusions: Godzilla Fileless Backdoors Targeting Atlassian Confluence
Reference: CVE-2023-22527 (CNA: 10.0/NVD: 9.8 critical, disclosed 16 January 2024 by Atlassian, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 January 2024) Atlassian Confluence Data Center and Server Template Injection Vulnerability (RCE)

Not even two days later, Trend Micro reports more CVE-2024-22527 exploitation. This time, a loader leads to an in-memory fileless backdoor known as the Godzilla webshell. The original malware author claims that Godzilla avoids detection by using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption for its network traffic and boasts a very low static detection rate across various security vendor products. Trend Micro describes the infection chain and shares IOC.

#threatintel #godzilla #backdoor #CVE_2023_22527 #Atlassian #Confluence #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-08-30T13:05:57.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Silent Intrusions: Godzilla Fileless Backdoors Targeting Atlassian Confluence
Reference: CVE-2023-22527 (CNA: 10.0/NVD: 9.8 critical, disclosed 16 January 2024 by Atlassian, added to CISA's KEV Catalog 24 January 2024) Atlassian Confluence Data Center and Server Template Injection Vulnerability (RCE)

Not even two days later, Trend Micro reports more CVE-2024-22527 exploitation. This time, a loader leads to an in-memory fileless backdoor known as the Godzilla webshell. The original malware author claims that Godzilla avoids detection by using Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) encryption for its network traffic and boasts a very low static detection rate across various security vendor products. Trend Micro describes the infection chain and shares IOC.

#threatintel #godzilla #backdoor #CVE_2023_22527 #Atlassian #Confluence #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity
